story:
On April 3rd Gregory Dolbashian's DASH Ensemble will premiere its newest evening length production, DASHOW at The DiMenna Center and we need YOUR help to bring DASHOW to life!


Help The DASH continue to perform and develop DASHOW

Over the course of the last year, Gregory Dolbashian and The DASH Ensemble is creating and developing DASHOW and now its ready to roll out to audiences all over New York and abroad, but we need your support in order to keep performing this exciting work.


A bit more about DASHOW. . .

Created by Gregory Dolbashian in collaboration with The DASH Ensemble, DASHOW integrates  dance, theater, narrative, and a touch of humour wrapped into a story focusing on the excitement and the fears of growing up. DASHOW first came from a small solo series Dolbasian created called Akward Magic, which was a series of personal stories and scenes from Dolbashian's life.

Engaging all 7 members of The DASH including himself, DASHOW expands on these personal stories bringing its audience into a world of fearlessness and at the same time deep vulnerability. Dolbashian's work has been called "fluid and inventive" and his artists have been described simply as "wonderful" both by The New York Times. Employing highly crafted languages both in their movement and in their theatricality, DASHOW brings out a vast range within each cast member. We see them shift between the identities of dancer, actor, poet,  performer, and just simply human. 


DASHOW Must Go On. . . 

To continue to self-produce DASHOW throughout New York and abroad is a big undertaking! The show consists of 11 members including our cast, our production team made up of our lighting, sound, and costume crew. We build everything ourselves. We take over spaces that are suitable for DASHOW but may be outside of the traditional dance venues and build out the entire production. Lighting, sound, even our own floor is supplied through our efforts in rentals, favors, and friends in the right places. We continue to fund everything on our own as a company. This campaign is the first step to evolving beyond that model. Our goal is to continue to bring DASHOW to various venues in NYC and abroad

In addition to this premiere date, a version of DASHOW will also be happening at SummerStage in Central Park in July and also again in September in a brand new dance series called Dance Crawl!

All contributions received through Indiegogo will go directly to the costs of executing and performing DASHOW. Your contributions help fund the theater rental, the rental of all of our lighting and sound equipment, all of our promotion material, and to costs of our wardrobe. By contributing you will be helping The DASH Ensemble consistently bring this great work to life and possibly even be the one who steals DASHOW!


Our way of saying "thanks!"

We welcome contributions of any size – big or small, every gift will bring us closer to achieving our goal.  For a gift of $25 or more you have the option to receive one of the special perks listed on this page – from personalized shout-outs to exclusive packages that include a printed photo, music download, personalized video thank-you, and an invitation to a studio rehearsal.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading the word is another valuable way you can help The DASH Ensemble

·  "Share" this campaign on Facebook and Twitter! Email it to your friends! 
·  Follow us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/TheDashEnsemble and twitter @DashEnsemble

. Get your ticket for DASHOW on April 3rd at http://dashow.brownpapertickets.com

story:
Our Campaign

MascallDance, a Vancouver, British Columbia dance organization, supporting the work of Artistic Director Jennifer Mascall, provides a forum for research, creation, performance, education and documentation of contemporary dance in combination with related disciplines. 

MascallDance is  remounting The Three Cornered Hat - A profoundly powerful study of movement, space and human interaction choreographed by Jennifer Mascall featuring the diverse talents of contemporary dancers - Lara Barclay, Amber Funk Barton, Dario Dinuzzi, Billy Marchenski, Darcy McMurray and Chris Wright. The piece was well received in it's premiere. As stated by the Alexander Varty, The Georgia Straight: "The Three Cornered Hat is hilarious, uncanny and conceptually stimulating, but it's also a sensory delight."  

We are asking for funds to costume our incredible dancers to ensure the work is enjoyed by audiences of all ages and maintain the safety of the dancers. 

To view a short clip of the Three Cornered Hat's last showing at Dancing on the Edge 2014 see below.


Where will your money go?

We need $2000.00 dollars to costume our dancers for our upcoming show. All funds will be going directly towards costuming our Dancers. As Amber said. 
  • $10 Could buy some socks
  • $50 Could buy a shirt
  • $100 could buy some pants

Details of The Three Cornered Hat

Venue: Scotiabank Dance Centre, 677 Davie Street, Vancouver

Dates: April 9 - 11; 8 PM
Tickets: $29/ $24, available in advance at Tickets Tonight, ticketstonight.ca, or at the door one hour prior to performance.

Choreography: Jennifer Mascall in collaboration with dancers
Dancers: Lara Barclay, Amber Funk Barton, Billy Marchenski, Darcy McMurray/Dario Dinuzzi, Chris Wright
Music Composition/Viola: Stefan Smulovitz
Set Design: Bill Pechet
Videographer: Candelario Andrade
Storyteller: Barbara Adler
Technical Director/Lighting Designer: John Macfarlane
Dramaturge: Susan McKenzie
Stage Manager: Alba Calvo
Photographer: Michael Slobodian

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign with your friends or anyone who could support MascallDance. Thankyou!

story:
PLEDGE NOW to support one of the finest new scripts written by a Los Angeles playwright! An all-star cast and crew bring will bring this gripping tale to life for 6 weeks only in this World Premiere production.

Corktown '57 is a powerful family drama about the IRA (Irish Republican Army) operating in America in the later 1950s at a time when various splinter groups had begun to advocate violence against civilian targets as a strategy to drive Britain from Ireland --- and to unite their country. The story dramatizes one such split within a first generation Anglo-Irish family when a British senior military officer, who is a brother and cousin to some, shows up in America on a covert mission of peace, using his unwitting brother to open secret back-channel negotiations with a moderate IRA commander --- who happens to be his cousin. This causes tremendous repercussions within the pro-Irish Republican family when his own father sets in motion a scheme to kidnap his own son in order to gain the release of 200 IRA men being held in detention in Ireland without right to trial or appeal. Events spiral out of control resulting in a tragedy on a Shakespearean scale.

Opening March 28th and running through May 3rd at The Odyssey Theatre, 2055 S. Sepulveda Blvd., Los Angeles.

Written by John Fazakerley

Directed by Wilson Milam (Lieutenant of Inishmore, RANK)

Starring: Jonah Beres, Josh Clark*, Andrew Connolly*, Eve Danzeisen*, Belen Greene*, Kevin P. Kearns*, John Ruby, Nick Tate*, Rebecca Tilney*  

Set Designer: Joel Daavid

Lighting Designer: Leigh Allen

Costume Designer: Jackie Gudgel

Sound Designer: Cricket S. Myers

Stage Manager: Marissa Drammissi 

Casting Director: Michael Donovan, CSA

Publicist: Lucy Pollak

Kearns*, John Ruby, Nick Tate*, Rebecca Tilney*  Set Designer: Joel DaavidLighting Designer: Leigh AllenCostume Designer: Jackie GudgelSound Designer: Cricket S. MyersStage Manager: Marissa Drammissi Casting Director: Michael Donovan, CSAPublicist: Lucy Pollak

story:
IL PROGETTO

Nel 2014 lo spettacolo Cyrano dans la Lune ha debuttato a Torino e nello stesso anno la Compagnia Villari-Deluca ha organizzato la sua prima tournée teatrale indipendente. Ora il progetto preme per raggiungere nuovi orizzonti, per superare i suoi limiti e per arrivare dove pochi hanno messo piede. Per crescere ed essere distribuito in modo capillare, raggiungendo anche la tua città, necessita di una produzione teatrale permanente. Ad alimentare questo viaggio sarà la complicità, il supporto e l’aiuto di tutti coloro che vorranno sostenere la prossima tournée, diventando assieme a noi co-produttori del progetto.

Sono circa 400.000 i km che ci separano dalla Luna. Il tragitto è lungo, ma più piacevole se fatto in compagnia. Noi abbiamo riempito i serbatoi per coprire i primi 75.000 km, ora contiamo su di voi. Prendiamo posizione e prepariamoci al decollo per partire assieme in questa nuova impresa: il conto alla rovescia è iniziato.


IL NOSTRO OBIETTIVO

Ci piace fare le cose con poco, ma così è veramente troppo poco!

Chiediamo la tua collaborazione e partecipazione per coprire i costi necessari a mettere in piedi una produzione teatrale che ci permetta di far evolvere lo spettacolo e gestire al meglio la prossima tournée teatrale. Saremo pretenziosi, ambiziosi o forse solo un poco folli…ma basta una piccola quota di complicità versata da ciascuno, e potremo mettere piede insieme sulla superficie lunare come già fece Cyrano.

Ogni 10 euro donati percorreremo 500 km.


LE RICOMPENSE

  • Donando diventerai di diritto nostro Co-produttore Guasconauta
  • Su tutti i materiali di comunicazione verrà introdotta la dicitura co-prodotto dal basso da: Compagnia Villari-Deluca + nº co-produttori Guasconauti
  • Il tuo nome apparirà anche nell’elenco ufficiale dei Gasconauti: il tuo ruolo verrà sempre riconosciuto.

  • Per ringraziarti abbiamo pensato a delle ricompense nella sezione “perks” di questa pagina.


COME UTILIZZEREMO IL TUO CONTRIBUTO

Per il lavoro sul palco 40 % (Scenografie: materiali + realizzazione + consulenza professionale / Sartoria: costumi e oggettistica + consulenza professionale / Disegno luci / Strumentazione tecnica)

Per il lavoro sulla creazione 17 % (Affitto spazio prove e residenza / Training teatrale e supervisione artistica / Trasporti e viaggi)

Per il lavoro sulla comunicazione 30 % (Servizi professionali: riprese video e montaggio + servizio fotografico / Costi di comunicazione, stampa, promozione e distribuzione)

Per il lavoro sulla campagna crowdfunding 13 % (Rimborsi competenze coinvolte / Costi di produzione e spedizione ricompense / Percentuali per la piattaforma crowdfunding e del sistema di pagamento)


PERCHE' DOVRESTI AIUTARCI?
  • Perché il nostro è un lavoro generoso, originale, in continuo divenire.
  • Perché tu possa vederlo nella tua città.
  • Perché diventerai un nostro alleato, compagno di viaggio e co-produttore.
  • Perché c'è una reale attenzione in quello che facciamo.
  • Perché non riceviamo fondi pubblici e non abbiamo adeguate risorse economiche per far evolvere il nostro progetto.
  • Perché siamo lavoratori dell’arte e dell’immateriale. Siamo precari, intermittenti, esseri in continuo disequilibrio. Abbiamo certamente qualcosa in comune.
  • Perché siamo per un Teatro capace di riconquistare il proprio “ruolo” nella società, consapevoli che fare arte e cultura significhi contribuire a migliorarci come uomini verso un’elevazione della coscienza collettiva.
  • Perché il “fare comune” è un’alternativa concreta per sottrarre le nostre vite agli effetti di un settore culturale in crisi.

COSA FARE PER ESSERE PARTE DELL'EQUIPAGGIO

“Credo nel vostro progetto e voglio essere un Guasconauta”:

Grazie! Guarda nella colonna affianco, scegli la cifra e il premio che vorresti in cambio della tua offerta.

“Credo nel vostro progetto, ma non posso permettermi molto”:

Grazie comunque! Anche il più piccolo contributo è fondamentale per noi: sarai anche tu un Guasconauta.

“Cos’altro posso fare?":

 Parla e fai parlare di noi. Condividi questo link, il nostro progetto e seguici sul web e dal vivo. In tutti i casi, te ne saremo molto grati!


COME DONARE

  • Seleziona una ricompensa (perk)
  • Clicca su continue to payment
  • Clicca su go to Paypal

Ora hai due alternative:

  • Se possiedi un conto Paypal effettua il login per concludere l'operazione.
  • Se NON possiedi un conto Paypal e desideri pagare con la tua carta di credito, clicca su PAY WITH A CREDIT OR DEBIT CARD. Immetti i tuoi dati e quelli della tua carta. (N.B.) Se non vuoi aprire un conto Paypal depenna il quadratino "Save this information with a PayPal account" e concludi l'operazione.

Per qualsiasi altra informazione

scrivi a: daniele.lele.villari@gmail.com

chiama: 349 5777546

seguici sulla pagina Facebook: Cyrano Social Clun - Compagnia Villari/Deluca https://www.facebook.com/cyranosocialclun

Saremo lieti di rispondere a tutte le tue domande!


Lo spettacolo

CYRANO DANS LA LUNE - Storia di un naso che voleva arrivare sulla Luna

  • di e con: Daniele Villari e Max Deluca
  • regia: Daniele Villari
  • disegno luci: Luca Carbone
  • riprese e montaggio: Patrizio Saccò 
  • musiche originali dal vivo: Max Deluca
  • co-produzione dal basso: Compagnia Villari-Deluca e nº Guasconauti

Una Luna, un marchingegno a rotelle, una valigia, una spada, due attori-clown (un poco attori e un poco clown) ed una storia. Quella di Cyrano de Bergerac: in questo caso "osservata" attraverso il personalissimo sguardo dei due protagonisti. Una storia che ha l'urgenza di essere raccontata, ancora oggi. Attraverso continui cambi di registro, lo spettacolo scivola dalla prosa al gioco clown, dalla parodia al melodramma e ben presto la narrazione sposta il piano del racconto sulla figura di Hercule Savinien Cyrano de Bergerac: l'uomo che ispirò la popolare opera di Edmond Rostand. Un uomo realmente esistito e non un personaggio di fantasia come spesso si crede, con una storia affascinante tutta da scoprire. Uno spirito libero ed un coraggioso, capace di raggiungere (primo tra tutti) la Luna.

approfondimenti sullo spettacolo alla pagina Facebook: Cyrano Social Clun https://www.facebook.com/cyranosocialclun


La Compagnia

Daniele Villari e Massimiliano Deluca si sono conosciuti, riconosciuti, inseguiti e picchiati frequentando il percorso triennale di formazione teatrale dell’Atelier Teatro Fisico diretto da Philip Radice. A Torino. La loro collaborazione nasce nel 2012. Il palcoscenico è il loro spazio di gioco. Tra i loro maestri, con cui hanno approfondito il lavoro dell’attore e lo studio sul clown: Philip Radice, Philippe Hottier, Jean Meningue, Eugenio Allegri, Laura Curino, Domenico Castaldo, Rita Pelusio, Loco Brusca, Ginevra Scaglia, Domenico Lannutti, Riccardo Maffiotti, Patrizia Besantini. La Compagnia Villari/Deluca è una giovane realtà, emergente e indipendente. Non accede ai contributi pubblici e si sostiene con le proprie forze. Per questo, il tuo contributo è ancora più prezioso per dare respiro ai suoi futuri progetti. Aiutaci a crescere!

story:
Hi This is Sherry!


I've been in the theater for 30 Years and still going strong. I have the honor of having the longest running one-woman show in Off-Broadway history with my solo show FAMILY SECRETS. That was back in 1994. So much has happened in the last 20 years which I find very useful as material for all the comedy I've written since then.  OH MY GODDESS! was supposed to be the next offering from me and my husband, director and Co-writer Greg Howells but he mysteriously vanished in June of 1997 and I was set on quite a detour into the responsibilities of raising my two daughters and could not return to the commitment of Full time theater. 

Fast forward 20 years. Kids are grown and doing great. I've been performing OH MY GODDESS! (and other comedies) all over California and now I've been chosen to perform at the United Solo Theater Festival in New York City this coming September. This is my golden opportunity to bring the Great Goddess, mother of us all, Ma to Broadway! It's finally time for me to return to my roots and bring the laughter and the tears of the mother to the masses. 

When you contribute to this campaign know that you will be a part of a huge effort to heal the world with the love and compassion that fills my work. If all goes well I could get a run on Broadway!!

But Sherry, Why Indie GoGo?

While this is an extraordinary opportunity, it costs $$$.  I have to pay $600 just to participate in the festival and I am responsible for airfare, meals, and lodging for myself and my stage manager/tech person.  I've also got to have new costumes made for Ma, the Jewish mother of us all and Miguel, her trusty vessel, needs some sprucing up too. When you contribute to this campaign I will provide you with a DVD of OMGS! and depending on how much your throw in the pishka you can get a DVD of FAMILY SECRETS, a copy of my memoir FAMILY SECRETS, copies of books containing my essays and my children's story CD, TATTERHOOD and Other Tales. If you contribute a major amount I will come and do a live performance of OMGS for you and your folks. Major contributors will get a DVD of the live performance in New York City.

The Impact

Many of you have seen my work and have been cheerleading me on all these years. And I thank you for all your words of praise and encouragement.  Now is the time to bring OMGS! to NYC.  FAMILY SECRETS was so successful it ran for 15 months off-broadway and paid investors back in the first 6 months. I can only imagine what OMGS! will do.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't afford a financial donation please share this page with friends and family. And please tell your kin in NYC to come see the show. The 1st show is Friday September 18th at 9PM. If that sells out I get another show. If the second one sells out I get another slot. It's possible I could do 8 shows! Tickets will go on sale this summer. Go to United Solo Theater Festival for more information. http://unitedsolo.org/us/

story:
Nate Rehman has been interested in dramatic violence since 2009 and has been training as much as he can here and there and all over.  Formally, Nate receives most of his training from his mentor, Thomas Usher, at Red Deer College.  This summer, Fight Directors Canada are putting together the opportunity Nate has been looking for!  An event in which he can certify with FDC!  Practitioners from all over Canada come to this event and share their knowledge and network with other enthusiasts of stage combat.  Not only will Nate be hoping to attend this event, he hopes to(and will) succeed at certifying.  Nate has been dreaming of going to an event like this for years now and he hopes that this time around, like other times, money wont be the issue.  Very shortly Nate hopes to put up a video of himself doing what he loves to do best!  That's FIGHT!  Thank you to everyone who supports him during this campaign and to all those who support him after!


Cheers!

story:
Short Summary

The People - 

The playwright is a survivor of childhood sexual abuse (CSA). Kammeran Giggers chose All the Beautiful Things after a child disclosed their abuse to her. Together they collaborated to bring this story to life. 

               

You will laugh. You will cry. You will fall in love with this tender story that punches you in the gut. 

The Play - 

Two kids meet one Sunday afternoon under the sanctuary of an old tree in the middle of a creek bed. Bit-Bit, the older city girl, and Man, the younger silly country boy, bicker and sass each other but eventually bond and form a friendship over their shared family secrets. Summers and Sundays pass and as they get older they gain strength from each other's company.

Parallel to their own friendship is the longer lasting one of Bit-Bit’s grandmother, Ida, and her best friend Teetsy.  As Bit-Bit and Man meet by their tree, Ida and Teetsy sit on a porch and avoid their own issues. Instead the two older women focus their talk on canning peaches, childhood, and daily lives. Neither speaks directly about their struggles.  

All come to a head as truth collides with family history, sparked by tragedy.

This play explores the cycle of sexual abuse in a family, the tendency to keep silent and look the other way, and the strength in speaking up and sparking a change.

One voice can leave an echo, millions of voices can breakthrough. With your contribution we can reach farther, shout louder, and help more.  

The space is free!

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to reach the $5,500 mark. To reward those who help us get there, we would like to show our thanks in the many ways listed to the side.

This is how your donations will be put to use:

$1800 - Production Design - We are building a claimable tree and porch and a creek! 

$400 - Costumes/Makeup/Hair - It's going to take a little effort to transform our 20 somethings cast in to children and old people in their late 50's...well at least believably. 

$550 - Other props - Hundreds of yards of ribbon. A huge part of the story that creates magical realism. They are in the tree. On the characters. Plus Muslin cloth to cover the entire stage for the funeral scene.  

$750 - Travel expenses for panel discussion and awareness rally

$650 - Post production/ Shipping/Storage. For some reason, our wonder team of recent graduates want to be paid for their editing services, so does UPS and the self storage center.  Plus our recent grads are the only people with enough time to create our fantastic behind the scenes trailers and DVD copies of the play. Basically, they need jobs. Help them out!

Anything raised in excess of the production costs will be donated to Georgia's Coastal Children's Advocacy Center! They will use the proceeds to directly assist child abuse victims.


The Impact

All the Beautiful Things is more than a thesis. It’s an opportunity to give voice to those continually told to be silent. 

So many affected by childhood sexual abuse (CSA) choose to stay silent due to shame, guilt, and rejection. When victims find the courage to disclose, too often friends and family don’t know how to respond. What do you say to a child whose trust has been violated? How do you help them heal? How do you deal with your own feelings of guilt, shame, and disbelief?

How can a play have an impact on such a uncomfortable subject? By raising awareness. By healing the shame. By bringing hope to the victims. 

Help us end the silence.

Listen to what others are saying about All the Beautiful Things:

The theatre has always been one of our society’s primary discussion and debating chambers.  Here, necessary topics in need of a conversation can finally receive a hearing; great questions seeking better answers may be aired and considered. Plays, by their very nature, attach human faces and souls to this process of social dialogue, allowing us to examine these issues through the additional lenses of action and emotion—involving not only the mind, but the soul and heart as well.

Ms. Jones' play has us consider the fates of sexual abuse survivors—many doing so through pluck and humor, if nothing else—and the ramifications of silence and sublimation. Affording all of us a greater understanding of some of those awkward silences in some family records.  Ms. Jones is a crafted and skilled voice; please consider supporting All the Beautiful Things, and allow the four wonderful creatures residing within to have full-throated voices and existence.

Laurence Ballard  
Professor of Performing Arts

"ALL THE BEAUTIFUL THINGS” by Masha T. Jones delivers a powerful theatrical journey, from sweet childhood moments to searing emotional confrontations. With her SCAD MFA thesis show, Kammeran Giggers has taken on a role that showcases her strength, sense of humor, and versatility as a performer. I can't wait to see the results, from this incredibly talented group of collaborators." 

-Playwright and SCAD Performing Arts Professor Kate Walat

I had the great honor of hosting a reading of Masha T. Jones’ play, All the Beautiful Things, at Savannah State University. All participants were deeply moved and eagerly anticipate its production. During the discussion afterward, the words “powerful”, “important,” and “true,” were used to describe what was heard. I believe Ms. Jones’ play to be a work of art, that should be supported, not only because of it’s important message; but also because of it’s heartbreakingly, beautiful language.

Renee Bishop 
Savannah State University
Executive Producer/Writer HBO, CBS, NBC and The History Channel


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate but love our cause? 
Help spread the word, like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter, make some noise, be heard. Send people our way and we will do the rest. And a big THANK YOU for adding your voice!
story_txt:
Short Summary 



The People - 
The playwright is a survivor of childhood sexual abuse (CSA). Kammeran Giggers chose All the Beautiful Things after a child disclosed their abuse to her. Together they collaborated to bring this story to life. 

               





You will laugh. You will cry. You will fall in love with this tender story that punches you in the gut. 


The Play - Two kids meet one Sunday afternoon under the sanctuary of an old tree in the middle of a creek bed. Bit-Bit, the older city girl, and Man, the younger silly country boy, bicker and sass each other but eventually bond and form a friendship over their shared family secrets. Summers and Sundays pass and as they get older they gain strength from each other's company.


Parallel to their own friendship is the longer lasting one of Bit-Bit’s grandmother, Ida, and her best friend Teetsy.  As Bit-Bit and Man meet by their tree, Ida and Teetsy sit on a porch and avoid their own issues. Instead the two older women focus their talk on canning peaches, childhood, and daily lives. Neither speaks directly about their struggles.  


All come to a head as truth collides with family history, sparked by tragedy.
This play explores the cycle of sexual abuse in a family, the tendency to keep silent and look the other way, and the strength in speaking up and sparking a change.

One voice can leave an echo, millions of voices
can breakthrough. With your contribution we can reach farther, shout
louder, and help more.  
The space is free!



What We Need & What You Get


We are trying to reach the $5,500 mark. To reward those who help us get there, we would like to show our thanks in the many ways listed to the side.
This is how your donations will be put to use:
$1800 - Production Design - We are building a claimable tree and porch and a creek! 
$400 - Costumes/Makeup/Hair - It's going to take a little effort to transform our 20 somethings cast in to children and old people in their late 50's...well at least believably. 
$550 - Other props - Hundreds of yards of ribbon. A huge part of the story that creates magical realism. They are in the tree. On the characters. Plus Muslin cloth to cover the entire stage for the funeral scene.  
$750 - Travel expenses for panel discussion and awareness rally
$650 - Post production/ Shipping/Storage. For some reason, our wonder team of recent graduates want to be paid for their editing services, so does UPS and the self storage center.  Plus our recent grads are the only people with enough time to create our fantastic behind the scenes trailers and DVD copies of the play. Basically, they need jobs. Help them out!
Anything raised in excess of the production costs will be donated to Georgia's Coastal Children's Advocacy Center! They will use the proceeds to directly assist child abuse victims.

The Impact



All the Beautiful Things is more than a thesis. It’s an opportunity to give voice to those continually told to be silent. 
So many affected by childhood sexual abuse (CSA) choose to stay silent due to shame, guilt, and rejection. When victims find the courage to disclose, too often friends and family don’t know how to respond. What do you say to a child whose trust has been violated? How do you help them heal? How do you deal with your own feelings of guilt, shame, and disbelief?
How can a play have an impact on such a uncomfortable subject? By raising awareness. By healing the shame. By bringing hope to the victims. 
Help us end the silence.Listen to what others are saying about All the Beautiful Things:The theatre has always been one of our society’s primary discussion and debating chambers.  Here, necessary topics in need of a conversation can finally receive a hearing; great questions seeking better answers may be aired and considered. Plays, by their very nature, attach human faces and souls to this process of social dialogue, allowing us to examine these issues through the additional lenses of action and emotion—involving not only the mind, but the soul and heart as well.Ms. Jones' play has us consider the fates of sexual abuse survivors—many doing so through pluck and humor, if nothing else—and the ramifications of silence and sublimation. Affording all of us a greater understanding of some of those awkward silences in some family records.  Ms. Jones is a crafted and skilled voice; please consider supporting All the Beautiful Things, and allow the four wonderful creatures residing within to have full-throated voices and existence.
Laurence
Ballard  Professor
of Performing Arts
"ALL THE BEAUTIFUL THINGS” by Masha T. Jones delivers a powerful theatrical journey, from sweet childhood moments to searing emotional confrontations. With her SCAD MFA thesis show, Kammeran Giggers has taken on a role that showcases her strength, sense of humor, and versatility as a performer. I can't wait to see the results, from this incredibly talented group of collaborators." -Playwright and SCAD Performing Arts Professor Kate WalatI had the great honor of hosting a reading of Masha T. Jones’ play, All the Beautiful Things, at Savannah State University. All participants were deeply moved and eagerly anticipate its production. During the discussion afterward, the words “powerful”, “important,” and “true,” were used to describe what was heard. I believe Ms. Jones’ play to be a work of art, that should be supported, not only because of it’s important message; but also because of it’s heartbreakingly, beautiful language.Renee Bishop Savannah State University Executive Producer/Writer HBO, CBS, NBC and The History Channel



    Other Ways You Can Help
Can't donate but love our cause? 
Help spread the word, like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter, make some noise, be heard. Send people our way and we will do the rest. And a big THANK YOU for adding your voice!

story:
¿PORQUÉ TE INVITAMOS A ESTA CAMPAÑA?

The following message will be translated to English down below:


  • -   Nosotros somos Teatro Espacio Agua Viva Austin (TEAV).  Hemos estado trabajando para la comunidad hispana desde el 2008. Nuestro trabajo ha estado siendo cada vez más reconocido por nuestra comunidad.

     No somos unos improvisados: su directora, Ana Laura de Santiago, ha sido maestra de Arte Dramático desde 1993: ha impartido incontables talleres de actuación para todas las edades y ha trabajado en más de 40 montajes, ya sea actuando, dirigiendo o produciendo, en las ciudades de Chihuahua, Delicias, y Guadalajara. Ana Laura ha tenido excelentes maestros de actuación, entre los que se encuentran: Pedro Antonio Laguna, Alexandro Soulé, Gerardo Castañeda, Genaro Ríos de la Rosa, Enrique Rubio y otros más. En su natal Delicias, Chihuahua, Ana Laura es reconocida como uno de los pioneros en materia teatral, reconocida en el libro "Delicias, 80 años" publicado hace dos años. Ha representado a su ciudad en muestras regionales y estatales de teatro, obteniendo merecidos reconocimientos. 


  • TEAV lleva el teatro al pueblo. El 99% de nuestras presentaciones al año son de entrada gratuita. Te preguntarás porqué.  Lo hacemos porque amamos lo que e hacemos y amamos a nuestra comunidad. Así de simple. No pretendemos vivir de esto. Lo hacemos GRATIS. Al ser pues un grupo independiente, TEAV no recibe ningún tipo de apoyo de ninguna entidad gubernamental ni civil. Es por ello que dependemos de nuestros propios recursos económicos para poder seguir haciendo lo que amamos y que es nuestra pasión: el teatro. Esta campaña pretende tocar tu corazón para poder seguir llevando al teatro a las calles y que deje de ser un espectáculo al que sólo acuden unos cuantos.

  • Al contribuir con nosotros, no importa la cantidad, estarás así mismo apoyando a tu comunidad hispana a que tenagan espectáculos gratuitos de mejor calidad, tanto visual como educativamente. Estarás siendo parte de un movimiento especial que nunca se ha visto antes en la comunidad hispana de Austin.

  • Tu aportación será utilizada estrictamente en la adquisición de materiales para vestuario, escenografía y utilería, iluminación y publicidad.

QUÉ NECESITAMOS Y QUE OBTENDRÁS AL APOYARNOS:

  • Necesitamos al menos $2,000 dólares. Ésto será íntegramente invertido en vestuario, escenografía, equipo de iluminación y sonido, Estamos acostumbrados a trabajar con pocos recursos, así que todo será sabiamente administrado.
  • Nunca se ha visto a un grupo de teatro HISPANO que trabaje en las calles de Austin GRATIS. Nosotros somos los primeros y los únicos interesados en llevar arte, cultura y entretenimiento sano a nuestra comunidad que nunca acude al teatro.
  • Te ofrecemos ser parte de este cambio, contribuyendo con nosotros desde un dólar. Tú podrás enterarte de cuándo y dónde estaremos presentando nuestro trabajo porque te mantendremos informado con un boletín mensual. Si posees un negocio, tu logo, tu imagen estará presente en nuestra publicidad, cualquiera que ésta sea.
  • SI NO PUEDES APOYARNOS ECONOMICAMENTE, pero si puedes apoyar dondnaod materiales como: telas, luces, cables, madera, muebles que no uses pero que esten en buen estado, no sabes como te lo vamos a gradecer! Tambien se aceptan donativos de impresiones (copias) para nuestros posters, programas de mano, etc. Tarjetas de regalo son tambien bienvenidas.

  • Tu que nos conoces, sabes que tipo de trabajo hacemos, y la calidad del mismo. Si aun no te ha tocado vernos, te invitamos a que lo hagas y te enteres de primera mano de como trabajamos. GRACIAS POR TU APOYO!

SI NO PUEDES APOYARNOS ECONOMICAMENTE, pero si puedes apoyar dondnaod materiales como: telas, luces, cables, madera, muebles que no uses pero que esten en buen estado, no sabes como te lo vamos a gradecer! Tambien se aceptan donativos de impresiones (copias) para nuestros posters, programas de mano, etc. Tarjetas de regalo son tambien bienvenidas.


Tu que nos conoces, sabes que tipo de trabajo hacemos, y la calidad del mismo. Si aun no te ha tocado vernos, te invitamos a que lo hagas y te enteres de primera mano de como trabajamos. GRACIAS POR TU APOYO!

story:
Summary

Originating in Harlem during the 1920s, a Rent Party played a major role in the development of jazz and blues music. It was a social occasion where tenants hire a musician or band to play and pass the hat to raise money to pay their rent.

Rain 2016 was a blast. I finally got to see the THING I wanted to give the blues scene here in Seattle get: a welcoming, inclusive, 3-long-nights of fun and connection. I love running this... and I finally feel like I've got a dedicated team who is ready to rock this year after year.

Rain City Blues will be fundraising in an effort to build community, have fun and provide better/faster service in Seattle's competitive and expensive event market. And its only just beginning!

Gifts for the whole community

These things happen no mater if we make this total during the indiegogo or after through combined efforts. Check the website to keep up to date!
  1. $???  Any amount of money helps. It means we'll be able to announce items early, throw community events throughout the year, and start working on lowering ticket prices, scholarships, and other fun and helpful things. 
  2. 25,000 "pre-funded" This means the ticket prices can be dropped in half for everyone. As bar to entry is usually the biggest problem, this takes care of A LOT. It means venues and teachers will get paid AND more of our friends can come dance.  
  3. 40,000 Rose's debts been paid... I might be hopeful for this... but I'm not counting on it. This amount represents Rose's Debt and every dollar we'd need to pay venues, teachers, bands, etc, in Seattle proper. If this goal were reached, prices could be dropped to about a 3rd of regular costs, savings for next year could occure, more classes can be added, scholarships would go in, and those who donated to the campaing could get discounts or free tickets for their perks. 

What We Need & Why

Let me level with you. We're not actually looking for 40,000 today... what ever we get helps! 40,000 is just our whole budget. That means that we would drop ticket prices super low, save up for next year, do scholarships... that kind of thing if we hit our budget total.

So this year is different... We want this community event to get ahead and start being more sustainable for organizers AND attendees 

  • Get crowd funding early so we can announce things early!
  • Get the venues, and get the best PARTS of the venues (so we're not in the back rooms of our classes... behind the school dance next year)
  • Make sure our venues stay IN CITY LIMITS (with good transportation and access)
  • start scholarship funding so that the community can help out those who don't make enough for full tickets
  • book teachers earlier and possibly for more
  • Help keep Rose on this by making up some of the debt she's held silently (thanks for throwing us a party Rose!)
What are you gonna get?
I'm SUPER excited to announce that the more "fully funded" we are by this campaign, the more stuff you'll get access to! Make SURE you give us an email when you donate because, depending on your donation level, you'll get access to SECRET DONATION GIFTS!! Sometimes FOR FREE (first come first serve). So through this campaign you can get things like:
  • Your next ticket for Rain 2017, through your base donation perk*
  • Discounts on your ticket for Rain 2017, Through your base donation perk*
  • Pre-purchase or FUND new cool swag for 2017
  • Fund the creation of SCHOLLARSHIPS for 2017 
  • Get old swag at a discount
  • Invitations to Rain Rent Parties!! Or even free admission! **

**Rain Rent Parties 

Okay... a little more on that one. 
So throughout the next year (at least once, more if the funds are going well) I'll be throwing some "Rent Parties" with fun music, themes and even some donated stuff... (if we get any... I'll throw an auction! I will!) Through your donation perk you will get invited to the "secret perk" only available when we email you the code. This might be a at full price, discounted price, or FREE depending on what "base" level donation you've made. 

You *might* also get access to an "open bar"... special guest area... some kind of gift... WHO KNOWS HOW DEEP THIS WILL GO!! 

But these parties will only be available to those who have made a base donation high enough to get the secret code!

Risks & Challenges... 5K minimum...

Yeah, there are risks.... Just two really... and only if people don't participate. 

  • If no one donates... we can't fund Rain. We need to hit AT LEAST 5,000 sometime this year in order to have a Rain 2017... this means if we raise under 5,000 Rose just pays some of her debt, throws you a thank you party or two, and we hope the best for all the other Blues events out there.
  • This stuff is gonna be hard to do... so donation levels and bonuses might not come... This would, again, be due to minimum donations happening. If we are making buck, guess what, we'll pass that buck to you in the form of cools stuff... if no one does more than the minimum.. you're not gonna get extra other than what comes with your base donation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to help more? Have an idea or an offer? EMAIL ME!!!!
raincityblues.rose@gmail.com with the subject: "I want to help, Rain 2017"

Ideas include:

  • Offer me something to auction! your time, art, things from your business... coupons... idk WHATEVER.
  • Offer me some of your volunteer time for the Rent Parties... I'll put you on a list and email you. I'll need you to make a "pay what you can" donation (anything...) and then you can go to the party in exchange for your time AT the party.
  • Business sponsorship? get me in good with your company... do they have a way of raising money for small businesses in the Seattle community?
  • Business partnership? Want to offer a coupon, goods or services, or something in trade? Wanna sell our participants something? EMAIL ME
  • ????????? be creative.... email me. 
(I reserve the right to say, "thanks but no" if I just can't use what you're offering... but I promise... I'LL TRY!)

Thanks everyone,
Rose

story:
The Birth of Melonlight Theater

We always knew it would come... The expansion of Melonlight School of Ballroom Dance & Yoga into an elegant and versatile theater. We've found the perfect venue for our professional ensemble to create and perform our original, unique, and edgy shows. The thing about being in the Melonlight is... you need light. But hold that thought, and let me tell you a little bit about:

Where We Came From

  • Little high school love birds, Raymond and Emma (that's me), dreamt up Melonlight about fifteen years ago. We've worked hard since then to develop our craft as dancers, choreographers, writers, artists, teachers, and of course entrepreneurs!
  • Our school offers a full schedule of dance and yoga to students of all ages. We've been profoundly affected and honored by the positive impact our classes and performances have had on our community. Thanks Melonheads. 
  • Within our professional ensemble our creativity runs wild! We produce shows of ever-changing genres with an intentional blending of dance, theater, story, powerful lighting, and delicate timing. We intend to invoke a certain kind of audience reaction; you'll have to let us know if we've succeeded ;)

Where We're Going

  • To a bigger space in historic downtown Eureka Springs, Arkansas where we can teach and entertain locals and tourists alike.
  • To the stars! A big empty room with beautiful hardwood floors and a high tin pressed ceiling is like a giant, blank white canvas to an ensemble of dancers and dreamers. The sky is the limit! 

So, about those stars we need...

Elements of Theatrical Magic

We're really lucky that our new venue is already well equipped for teaching dance and yoga. What's lacking are the elements of theatrical magic (aka our stars): lighting, curtains, behind the scenes equipment, and technical software. A grand total of $12,000 will give us all the funding needed to create a customizable venue that can morph to meet the needs of each unique show or event. From ballroom, to thrust stage, to proscenium, to theater in the round; the creative design work we do now will support our shows for years to come, so it's important that we do it right. Funds from this campaign will pay for:

  • Theatrical lighting, rigging equipment, and technical design software
  • A projector and screen to support the photo and video aspects of our shows
  • A fresh coat of paint to reflect our beautiful new LEDs
  • Frames with castors to be built for our mirrors and chalk boards
  • Curtains for backstage and wings
  • A jumpstart on our first show for the new theater, I Dreamt of Tango, to cover costuming, set, props, etc

I Dreamt of Tango

Our new show is a dream, and you are the dreamer. Move back in time and step into the river of tango; a connected flow of energy, passion and story; a journey through a surreal world where your pounding heartbeat seduces you with inquiry... what does it mean to be authentic? Take our word, philosophy has never been so sexy. Experience the sensory world of tango, and come alive in our new theater this June at the premiere of I Dreamt of Tango.

Testimonials

Our shows and classes have been well loved by our communities in both Denver and Eureka Springs. Here are some kind words from our fans (we call them Melonheads).

  • "With endless energy, creativity, humor, and patience, Emma and Ray share their art, sprinkling fairy dust on anyone wishing to partake. In a community blessed with talent and diversity, Melonlight sparkles!" -Alicia
  • "Ray and Emma are consummate professionals. They are also two of the kindest people I know which makes them incredible teachers. I fell in love with Emma's yoga class from the minute I walked in. The clean, warm, studio was filled with beautiful music, light incense wafted in the air and Emma's skill, demeanor and beautiful flow kept me coming back week after week. Professional, knowledgeable, prepared and FUN!!!" -Carrie
  • I hadn't danced for years (except alone in my living room) and I was so delighted to discover Melonlight. My son, daughter, and I soon became Melonheads and I always left the studio feeling refreshed down to my bones. Melonlight offers not just a fun outlet and alternative to traditional exercise but nourishment for your soul. Ray and Emma are two of the kindest souls I've ever met. They give so much of themselves to their art and their students. Their enthusiasm and love of each other and of life in general are contagious. I thank God that He created these two special souls and delivered them to our little community." -Nicole

Give & Receive 

This is where we say please. Pretty please. Pretty please with a watermelon slice on top. While we may not be rich in money, we are rich in love, passion, creativity, motivation, hard work, and community. We do this work because it feeds us happiness, joy, and inspiration. And as teachers and performers, we share what we eat; so happiness, joy, and inspiration is what we intend to give back again and again, plus some thoughtful thanks, awesome Melonlight gear, show tickets, classes, and more! So please donate to our new theater and show. And if you can't donate then step outside and shout it from the rooftops, and Facebook, and Instagram, and Indiegogo's forum: "Melonlight needs your help to keep on going and growing!"
With love and creation at the root of every action, we say thank you!                                               Emma, Raymond, Maggie, Caia & Jerry
story_txt:
The Birth of Melonlight Theater

We always knew it would come... The expansion of Melonlight School of Ballroom Dance & Yoga into an elegant and versatile theater. We've found the perfect venue for our professional ensemble to create and perform our original, unique, and edgy shows. The thing about being in the Melonlight is... you need light. But hold that thought, and let me tell you a little bit about:
Where We Came From

Little high school love birds, Raymond and Emma (that's me), dreamt up Melonlight about fifteen years ago. We've worked hard since then to develop our craft as dancers, choreographers, writers, artists, teachers, and of course entrepreneurs! Our school offers a full schedule of dance and yoga to students of all ages. We've been profoundly affected and honored by the positive impact our classes and performances have had on our community. Thanks Melonheads. 
Within our professional ensemble our creativity runs wild! We produce shows of ever-changing genres with an intentional blending of dance, theater, story, powerful lighting, and delicate timing. We intend to invoke a certain kind of audience reaction; you'll have to let us know if we've succeeded ;)  Where We're Going





To a bigger space in historic downtown Eureka Springs, Arkansas where we can teach and entertain locals and tourists alike.


To the stars! A big empty room with beautiful hardwood floors and a high tin pressed ceiling is like a giant, blank white canvas to an ensemble of dancers and dreamers. The sky is the limit! 

   So, about those stars we need...
Elements of Theatrical Magic We're really lucky that our new venue is already well equipped for teaching dance and yoga. What's lacking are the elements of theatrical magic (aka our stars): lighting, curtains, behind the scenes equipment, and technical software. A grand total of $12,000 will give us all the funding needed to create a customizable venue that can morph to meet the needs of each unique show or event. From ballroom, to thrust stage, to proscenium, to theater in the round; the creative design work we do now will support our shows for years to come, so it's important that we do it right. Funds from this campaign will pay for:
 Theatrical lighting, rigging equipment, and technical design software
A projector and screen to support the photo and video aspects of our shows
A fresh coat of paint to reflect our beautiful new LEDs
Frames with castors to be built for our mirrors and chalk boards
Curtains for backstage and wings
A jumpstart on our first show for the new theater, I Dreamt of Tango, to cover costuming, set, props, etc    I Dreamt of Tango Our new show is a dream, and you are the dreamer. Move back in time and step into the river of tango; a connected flow of energy, passion and story; a journey through a surreal world where your pounding heartbeat seduces you with inquiry... what does it mean to be authentic? Take our word, philosophy has never been so sexy. Experience the sensory world of tango, and come alive in our new theater this June at the premiere of I Dreamt of Tango.   Testimonials  Our shows and classes have been well loved by our communities in both Denver and Eureka Springs. Here are some kind words from our fans (we call them Melonheads).  "With endless energy, creativity, humor, and patience, Emma and Ray share their art, sprinkling fairy dust on anyone wishing to partake. In a community blessed with talent and diversity, Melonlight sparkles!" -Alicia



"Ray and Emma are consummate professionals. They are also two of the kindest people I know which makes them incredible teachers. I fell in love with Emma's yoga class from the minute I walked in. The clean, warm, studio was filled with beautiful music, light incense wafted in the air and Emma's skill, demeanor and beautiful flow kept me coming back week after week. Professional, knowledgeable, prepared and FUN!!!" -Carrie


I hadn't danced for years (except alone in my living room) and I was so delighted to discover Melonlight. My son, daughter, and I soon became Melonheads and I always left the studio feeling refreshed down to my bones. Melonlight offers not just a fun outlet and alternative to traditional exercise but nourishment for your soul. Ray and Emma are two of the kindest souls I've ever met. They give so much of themselves to their art and their students. Their enthusiasm and love of each other and of life in general are contagious. I thank God that He created these two special souls and delivered them to our little community." -Nicole
    Give & Receive 
This is where we say please. Pretty please. Pretty please with a watermelon slice on top. While we may not be rich in money, we are rich in love, passion, creativity, motivation, hard work, and community. We do this work because it feeds us happiness, joy, and inspiration. And as teachers and performers, we share what we eat; so happiness, joy, and inspiration is what we intend to give back again and again, plus some thoughtful thanks, awesome Melonlight gear, show tickets, classes, and more! So please donate to our new theater and show. And if you can't donate then step outside and shout it from the rooftops, and Facebook, and Instagram, and Indiegogo's forum: "Melonlight needs your help to keep on going and growing!"With love and creation at the root of every action, we say thank you!                                               Emma, Raymond, Maggie, Caia & Jerry

story:
Hi  Everyone, 

  I am Parenthysis Gardner  a volunteer with the Friends Of Robey. The Friends of Robey works exclusively with the Robey Theater helping with fundraising events,  theater performances, festivals and most of their creative projects. I  have been a part of team  as an active volunteer for the historical Robey Theater  Company for  the last two years.  The company has been my second home since I moved to the California area. Since becoming a part of the Friends of Robey's team and being exposed to the Robey Theater Company , I've learned from  some of the greatest legendary artist, actors, musicians, writer, and  producers,  in the business. I have gained a wide  variation  of knowledge and a  new more meaningful perspective of  what the Arts  has ,will and can do when aided with a genuine purpose,.

The Robey  is  a non- profit Theater Company that takes its name from the revolutionary Black actor and activist Paul Robeson.   Robey's focus is to develop new works, re-examine, and present established works about the global Black experience by offering intensive workshops, writing, acting programs and presenting theater festival in collaboration with ground-breaking playwrights, actors, and artist of color.  This allows for the development and exhibition of innovative new plays that explore the Black experience past, present, and future. With over twenty years of dedication and excellence to the theater national community, Robey has  established an environment that is rich in culture and is crucial to humanity.

In an effort to secure the continued success of these workshops and programs, The Friends of Robey are presenting the Live to Love Explosion. These performers are dedicating their time and gifts in order to help raise the funds, with this and your  support, we are optimistic that we can meet our goal of raising $10,000.  We look forward t hearing from you and  even  partnering with you for years to come.  Please follow our journey! Thank you so much for your time and consideration!

Sincerely,

Parenthysis E Gardner

story:
Who are we?

URPO Arts is a collective of passionate dancers, musicians, artists, and other various storytellers who seek to inspire and motivate others.

Our debut production, This Too Will Be Swept Away, will be premiering at the 2016 Orlando International Fringe Festival. The show is the story of a group of strangers, down on their luck, who find each other along the same path, all seeking a chance for change. 

What We Need & What You Get

Let's be honest, Fringe is expensive and the starving artist stereotype persists for a reason. We're seeking funding to cover the cost of show related fees, advertising, and rehearsal pizza so we can put our focus on the creation of the show.

We're proud to offer an exclusive download of original music to our patrons, as well as a special something something to our more generous supporters.  

Support Local Art

Art is a great beast made up of the collective thoughts, desires, and expressions of everyone that calls themselves an artist. We truly believe that supporting local art is key to keeping art alive and diverse. So donate to show your support for local art and be sure to come check out “This Too Will Be Swept Away” and the many other incredible performances happening this May at the Orlando Fringe!

Other Ways You Can Help

We get it, you're broke too. That's ok, because you can still support just by spreading the love. Like us on Facebook and Instagram, share our link with everyone you know, tell your rich relatives to give us money. Write a message in the sky telling everyone to come see us at the Fringe!

story:
When and where will Fangirls (An Improbable Cosplay) be performed?

When: 
July 22 - Friday - 7:30pm
July 23 - Saturday - 9:00pm
July 29 - Friday - 6:00pm

Where: 
Mesner Puppet Theater
1006 Linwood Blvd
Kansas City, MO 64109

Follow this link for ticketing info:
http://kcfringe.org/fangirls-an-improbable-cosplay/

Play Synopsis

A female author, Emma Orczy, wrote a play and created the first masked superhero, The Scarlet Pimpernel, in 1903. In the 113 years since, boys have left girls out of the genre a girl created. Three girls decide to take back what belongs to them, staging a demonstration in the middle of Comicon.

Why were you at Planet Comicon?

Since the play will be performed as part of KC Fringe Festival this July, we wanted to connect with cosplayers, cosplay fans, and fans of all kinds. Why? Because we can't do this alone. We need your help!

Calling All Cosplayers!

We want to create a mini-Comicon atmosphere before, after, and around the play. Details TBD, but if you're a woman with a costume and you're interested, please contact us at BrickStreetTheatre@gmail.com to learn more.

Follow / Like / Retweet / Share

Twitter - @BrickStreet
Facebook.com/FangirlsThePlay

Please contribute to our IndieGoGo fundraising campaign!

We are raising funds to pay our actors (first!) and cover production costs! Basically, we have seed money to get the play into the KC Fringe Festival, but we need additional funds raised so our actors can get paid for their hard work and talents.

Any proceeds after actor paychecks and production costs will be used to incorporate Brick Street Playwriting Den as a non-profit to continue our work in the KC area.

What is Brick Street?

Brick Street Theatre Playwriting Den provides writing workshop opportunities with the goal to bring fresh voices to the stage. Brick Street has a laser focus on women-created works and a strongly monitored standard of diverse casting. We play house, as the island of misfit toys, thus creating a fringe environment that runs 365 days a year. We are firmly dedicated to allowing everyone their turn in the sandbox.

Based in the Kansas City area, we are improving the community through theatre productions and playwriting workshops, with a focus on voices of women and people of color. Find us at www.BrickStreet.org!

Hey! What about perks?

We are adding perks right now! Please stay tuned. Donate now, and once they're determined, we'll be sure you get any perks that would apply to you.

**Special Note about Perks**

Sorry, but some of the perks will only be available for donors who are able to travel to the Kansas City area to attend the KC Fringe Festival, performances of Fangirls: An Improbable Cosplay, and the cast party. You will cover all travel, lodging, and entertainment expenses, unless otherwise specified in the perk description. We will not ship perks outside the Continental U.S.

story:
My name is Charles Curtis, writer and director of the play called “Strings”. I wrote this piece at a time where the value of a life of a man of color was worthless. Seeing so many of our black and brown men gunned down stirred something in me. That thing said write. I’m often asked why I wrote this play. I wrote this piece to give voice to the scores of men of color gunned down in the street. Young men like Trayvon, Tamir, Akai and others with so much to live for, and so much left to do. Like me, others have been stirred to stand up for their sons, their fathers, their brothers and uncles. That is what “Strings” is about. “Strings” is about a modern day vigilante, a lawyer with an ulterior motive, and the strings that bind them both.

The cast and crew of this production is so grateful for the opportunity to present this piece in it's FIRST festival appearance, being selected in full performance at the 2016 Atlanta Black Theatre Festival, October 12-15. Unfortunately, all of the costs for travel, lodging, marketing, etc, are all up to us. While we're working hard to present the best possible show for the festival, we need your help to make sure that we get there, we get butts in the seats, and that no one has to stow away in the trunk of a car on our way to Atlanta. 

We need this money to not only create the kind of amazing show we can all be proud of, but to set us apart from every other festival show. Truthfully, festival appearances can be career changing. Your donations not only help to offset the cost of festival expenses, but has the potential to propel our careers. Aside from all of that, we need this money because this story is important, it touches people, and our stories need to be told. 

Not to mention, with your donation, you get some pretty cool gifts: from signed copies of the script, to an opportunity to hang out with the cast and crew and an undisclosed location during the festival. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute (just yet), it that doesn't mean you can't help:
  • Help get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Help at an upcoming fundraising event
  • Become and intern/assistant for a day? Week? Month?
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

The Southwest's Most Beautiful, Talented and Humble Drag Theater Troupe "THE DOLLS" presents the REGIONAL PREMIERE of Priscilla Queen of the Desert starring London West End Original Cast Member, Phillip Arron as Bernadette, Christopher Garcia-Wright as Tick and you know him as Toni in West Side Story at ALT, Nicholas Handley as Felicia/Adam. Proceeds go to NMAS (New Mexico Aids Services).

Fresh from the Broadway and West End Show and tours, we are the first company to perform this spectacular and fabulous show! And we are so excited and grateful to be performing on the wonderful stage of National Hispanic Cultural Center -Journal Theatre.

A fabulous cast, a fabulous show and a fabulous partnership with New Mexico Aids Services non-profit (NMAS) to help raise money and awareness for their cause... where can you go wrong? (NMAS provides high quality and non-judgmental science-based health promotion, with disease prevention interventions that are focused on the community, the family, and the client.)

What We Need

  • Revolving bus on stage with a bar set.
  • Many fabulous glittering costumes, masks and wigs/headresses.
  • General overall costs

What You Get

  • Many wonderful perks- see our perks page!
  • To see a wonderfully amazing and camp show!
  • To know you have assisted one of the most needed non-profit organizations in the state!

The Impact

Please help us raise enough money to build our fabulous set, pay for the rent and market our show so we can raise lots of money and awareness for New Mexico Aids Services!!! The more we raise, the more we are able to give back!

Risks & Challenges

  • This is a very challenging show as there is a huge cast, many costumes and a very intricate set needed to make it stand out.
  • As the first regional production of this show - getting the word out is crucial, please help in every way you can.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our show.
  • Share Indiegogo with everyone you know!
  • Volunteer your time as a fundraiser or crew.

story:
Short Summary

This project was such a success!! Thank you to everyone who supported us in this endevour, it was definitely a challenging journey.  I would love to hear feedback from anyone who attended the performance so I can grow as an artist and know how it was received.  Please send me a message through the indiegogo messenger! We fell short of our total amount, but fortunately we were able to accommodate most of the expenses.  I only had to pay about 200 our of pocket, and the performers volunteered their time.  If you feel compelled, this campaign is still accepting donations! It would go to covering the out of pocket cost of rolling up the marly and paying the artists.  Any amount would be very appreciated!
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
My name is Haylee Warner, and this project is a collaborative approach to breaking down the borders of Imperialism.  It is my senior thesis project as I complete my degree at The University of the Arts.  We are approaching this huge task through our personal experiences, academic and movement research.  We are creating an interactive performance with an original sound score and elaborate hand made costuming to literally embody imperialism in its various forms (patriarchy, racism, misogyny, capitalism ect.)  This process has been long and rewarding for all of us as we learn more about each other and critically examine how we interact with the world and how we are all products of this engrained system. 
My collaborators are extremely important to me, as I could never attempt this massive project alone.  They all come from different artistic and cultural backgrounds and are listed below.
Austin - Music Business
Stephanie - Dance
Danica - Industrial Design
Maggie- Creative Writing
Nicole - Dance
Andrew - Sculpture
James- Theater
Mawiyah- Dance (Rehearsal Assistant)

The performance is free to attend!

April 2nd and 3rd at 5pm

at

The Iron Factory (118 Fontain st. Philadelphia, PA)

Presented along side this work will be two more original works by Uarts Dance Seniors! I sincerely hope you can come and enjoy all of the performance.

What We Need & What You Get

For this performance to have the most impact there are a few aspects that are critical to the presentation.  

1) Having multiple perspectives informing the work.

2)Ample time in the studio

3) Proper costuming and props to develop images and relate to the audience.

We have tried our best to cover the first two aspects.  This has shown through our committed and diverse cast, and the assistance of new people in rehearsals helping us shape and present our images.  

We are asking you to help us fund these extensive, but crucial costumes and props.

Each collaborator's costume will cost between 50-100 dollars.  We are buying materials, props, makeup, face prosthetics and paying for a seamstress to help us make and design each character's individual costume.

I also believe that it is extremely important to pay artists for their time and dedication.  Any additional money will go to the collaborators for over a year's worth of rehearsal and research.  

Finally the location is in Kensington and requires money for travel to get to and from the site.  We are hoping to have enough money to pay for the audience's travel from Center City to Kensington so the work is accessible to as many people as possible.

So, rounding out the numbers...

Costumes: $100x7=700

Travel: $350 (4.50 per audience member + gas and tokens for each rehearsal for                                  the cast)

Pay: $50x9=450

=

$1500

For your donation you can receive various perks :)

Each donation of $20 or more will receive a handwritten thank you card.

Each donation of $100 or more will have the opportunity to attend one rehearsal and become a part of the process!

The Impact

We are hoping to shift our audience's perspective and really get people thinking about how and why our society is controlled by these various forms of imperialism.  If we can get people thinking and learning about these harmful infrastructures, then maybe we can start to do something about them.  

Your donation brings us that much closer to the ultimate goal of education and change!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone has the monetary means to help us financially.  No worries! Sharing this post and spreading the word is just as important. We appreciate any and all help!
