Thank you!

story:
The Project

LITTLE is a delightful musical reimagining of the folktale Chicken Little.  It’s about an awkward chicken who feels he can’t live up to the expectations of his macho rooster of a father.  Little’s life is transformed when he gets hit in the head with a piece of the sky.  He runs away in a panic to warn the word of its impending doom. Along the way he meets the carefree Ducky Lucky, the deeply insecure Turkey Lurkey, and the kooky Goosey Loosey.  The play features a live folk band, puppets, an overabundance of bird puns, and as much joyous and simple theatrical magic as we can pack onto a stage.

We've been offered the incredible opportunity to participate in a residency at The Barn Arts Collective on Mount Desert Island, Maine.  During our week at The Barn, we'll perform the show for family audiences and students at the local elementary school.  The residency itself is free, but we need to pay for transportation, food, stipends for our team, and the building of multiple puppets that feature in the show.

This campaign is important because it will allow us to make the most of this prestigious residency.  Our time spent there will help us ensure the show is made to the highest standards so that when we return to NYC, LITTLE will be ready to present to audiences and critics.  Our ultimate goal is to bring this play to as wide of an audience as possible, and in achieve that it needs to shine when it debuts in the city.

 

About Us

We are Kristin McCarthy Parker (director), Colin Waitt (book), and Wesley Zurick (music & lyrics).  

Collectively we have a proven track record of creating shows that strike a chord with a wide audience.  Kristin and Colin are part of the team that created PUFFS, which began life at The Peoples Improv Theater and is currently running off-Broadway at New World Stages.  Its Australian production was the longest running show in Melbourne in 48 years, and a filmed version of the original off-Broadway cast was distributed by Fathom Events in May.  Wes' BIBLE STORIES! was a runaway hit when presented by The Atlantic Farm Team.  His work has also been produced at The Bushwick Starr, The Bowery Poetry Club, Judson Memorial Church, and The Cincinnati Fringe Festival.

Our complete bios can be found at the end of this pitch.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to achieve the goals of our residency, we need to raise funds for the following:

  • Rental car transportation (including gas) for our team of 8 who'll spend the week at The Barn
  • Food for the week
  • Materials to build our puppets, including a larger than life Foxy Loxy, a chorus of squirrels, and an overly friendly dog.  Our puppets are being designed and built by the amazing Kayla Prestel.
  • Stipends for our team at The Barn as well as stipends for our choreographer and puppet designer/builder

As thanks for your donation, we offer a variety of perks, including tickets to see the show when it performs in NYC and producer credits.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Crowdfunding is a a popular way of raising funds to make theater.  Our feeds are full of pitches, and we're sure yours are too.   We know that it's impossible to donate to every project you come across, so if you are't able to financially back LITTLE, you can help by getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign on social media, in emails, and in person.  Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

Bios

Here's more info about the three of us:

Kristin McCarthy Parker is a freelance director in New York City and founding member of Recent Cutbacks. Her work includes Matt Cox’s Puffs (New World Stages) and Kapow-i GoGo, Recent Cutbacks’ KEVIN!!!!!, Hold On To Your Butts, and Fly, You Fools!. She has directed and developed work at Williamstown Theatre Festival, Ma-Yi, 59E59, The Flea, HERE Arts, Dixon Place, Columbia University, Atlantic Acting School, and the University of Florida, among others. Assistantships include Ed Iskandar, Michael Greif, Wendy Goldberg, and Trip Cullman.

Colin Waitt is a playwright, producer, and performer.  His work has been produced by The PIT, The Tank, This Is Not a Theater Company, Dixon Place, Undiscovered Countries, and The Minnesota Fringe Festival.  He is a member of the Writer’s Work Writing Group. His short play, The Pain of Loving You, was a finalist for the Ken Davenport Short Play Prize.  Colin produced the original run of Puffs and associate produces it off-Broadway at New World Stages.  He is reteaming with the creative team behind Puffs to make The Magnificent Revengers.  He is an associate producer at Tilted Windmills Theatricals.  Select producing credits: SERIALS (The Flea), Kapow-i GoGo (The PIT), Our House in Concert (Associate Producer, London’s West End).

Wesley Zurick is an actor and composer living in Brooklyn. Recent credits include: New York: On the Shore of the Wide World (Atlantic Theater Company), Big Green Theatre 7.0 (Bushwick Starr), Bible Stories! (Atlantic Farm Team), The Lightning Thief (Theatreworks USA), The Velveteen Rabbit, Camp Kapawanna, Mr. Chickee’s Funny Money (Atlantic for Kids), Boats And (Ars Nova’s ANT Fest), Welcome to the Jungle (Living Record Collection), I’s Twinkle (Pipeline Theatre Company). Regional: The Trestle at Pope Lick Creek (Playhouse on Park), Ace (Playhouse in the Park). As a playwright and composer his work has been produced by The Atlantic Farm Team, Ape` Shakespeare, The Bushwick Starr, The Bowery Poetry Club, Judson Memorial Church, The Cincinnati Fringe Festival, The Joust Theatre Company and The Rescignos.

story:
The Long & Short

The SoHo Shakespeare Company was founded on a beautiful, cold, Manhattan afternoon — sun blazing, blustery, and snow-whipped.  It was a meeting at The Coffee Shop; lunch between two dear old friends.  Morgan Sullivan and I have known one another since 2010: as students, artists, activists, New Yorkers, and now as entrepreneurs.  When I handed Morgan the first draft of 'The Sisters' on that frigid January afternoon everything shifted at once and fell into place.  Morgan agreed that theater, especially Shakespeare, needed a new mission statement, so we teamed up, co-Founders and co-Artistic Directors, with near vaulting ambition.  With this play, and our outstanding team of artists, we lay the foundation for our strongest artistic statement to date: The SoHo Shakespeare Company, pursuing knowledge beyond what is taught.

'The Sisters', adapted from Shakespeare’s ‘Macbeth’, is vastly different from what is routinely taught.  It tells the story of Lady Macbeth, the Weird Sisters, and the other non-male characters; a story cut out and buried by over four-hundred-years of Shakespearean intelligentsia.   In accepting this current gospel we perpetuate assuredly antiquated ideals that further vilify the marginalized and deny equity.  Here we offer you something very different on something very old.   We hope you’ll join us and support us in this pursuit of knowledge.

— Alexander Pepperman | Playwright

Who We Are

            — Morgan Sullivan | co-Founder & co-Artistic Director

                        They | Them | Theirs 

            — Alexander Pepperman  |  co-Founder & co-Artistic Director

                         He | Him | His

            — Madison Reiske  | Executive Producer

                         She | Her | Hers

            — Laura Yumi Snell  | Producer

                         She | Her | Hers

            — Matthew Vitticore  |  Associate Producer

                         He | Him | His

            — Zoe Watkins  |  Associate Producer

                         She | Her | Hers

What We Need

Every penny of your donations is an investment in our inaugural production, and an investment in us.

  • Artist Pay
  • Crew Pay
  • Theater Rental
  • Workshop Space
  • Rehearsal Space
  • Props
  • Costumes
  • Set Design
  • Lighting Design
  • Sound Design
  • Promotion
  • and more…

...we anticipate a cost of approximately $30,000.  We’re hoping to raise half of our budget here, with you as our advocates.  

What You Get

In return for your support you will join our family and our team.  You'll receive premiums ranging from cast-signed posters to production credits, and for the extraordinarily generous: original art from our company members.

The Impact

This project is valuable not only the artists creating it, but to our community here in New York, and the world at large.  There is still so much to be learned from our Classical artists, lessons that we shy away from for fear of upsetting the status quo.  A portion of our proceeds will go to the charity RAINN, the nation’s largest anti-sexual violence organization.

Challenges

“Our doubts are traitors,

And make us lose the good we oft might win, 

by fearing to attempt.”

            — ‘Measure for Measure’ 1.4.78

The organizational effort required to run this theatrical production will be tremendous.  We’ll be employing a company of roughly 20 artists for two months in the spring, plus our upcoming winter workshop.  The people coordinating our business and artistic ventures at present are doing so out of passion and the strongest belief in our work and mission.  There are seven of us now, and we are growing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sponsor Us:  Do you operate a company looking for artistic ventures to support?  Contact us to discuss potential company or seasonal sponsorships.

Send a tax-deductible donation to us through our fiscal sponsor, Fractured Atlas.

Share our campaign and mission online:  Facebook  |  Instagram

Audition for us:  Keep your eyes peeled for our casting notice in late winter!
story_txt:
The Long & ShortThe SoHo Shakespeare Company was founded on a beautiful, cold, Manhattan afternoon — sun blazing, blustery, and snow-whipped.  It was a meeting at The Coffee Shop; lunch between two dear old friends.  Morgan Sullivan and I have known one another since 2010: as students, artists, activists, New Yorkers, and now as entrepreneurs.  When I handed Morgan the first draft of 'The Sisters' on that frigid January afternoon everything shifted at once and fell into place.  Morgan agreed that theater, especially Shakespeare, needed a new mission statement, so we teamed up, co-Founders and co-Artistic Directors, with near vaulting ambition.  With this play, and our outstanding team of artists, we lay the foundation for our strongest artistic statement to date: The SoHo Shakespeare Company, pursuing knowledge beyond what is taught.'The Sisters', adapted from Shakespeare’s ‘Macbeth’, is vastly different from what is routinely taught.  It tells the story of Lady Macbeth, the Weird Sisters, and the other non-male characters; a story cut out and buried by over four-hundred-years of Shakespearean intelligentsia.   In accepting this current gospel we perpetuate assuredly antiquated ideals that further vilify the marginalized and deny equity.  Here we offer you something very different on something very old.   We hope you’ll join us and support us in this pursuit of knowledge.— Alexander Pepperman | PlaywrightWho We Are            — Morgan Sullivan | co-Founder & co-Artistic Director                        They | Them | Theirs             — Alexander Pepperman  |  co-Founder & co-Artistic Director                         He | Him | His            — Madison Reiske  | Executive Producer                         She | Her | Hers            — Laura Yumi Snell  | Producer                         She | Her | Hers            — Matthew Vitticore  |  Associate Producer                         He | Him | His            — Zoe Watkins  |  Associate Producer                         She | Her | HersWhat We NeedEvery penny of your donations is an investment in our inaugural production, and an investment in us.
Artist Pay
Crew Pay
Theater Rental
Workshop Space
Rehearsal Space
Props
Costumes
Set Design
Lighting Design
Sound Design
Promotion
and more…

story:
Let Rose explain all about the Q&Q

We Stand on our Threshold

For seven years now, the Q&Q has been experimenting and working out the techniques that make LIVE ANIMATED PERFORMANCE possible.   So what's next?  Letting the world see it!  We are going in two directions:

RisingSun Laboratorium, NYC

Rising Sun Theater Laboratorium - a developmental theater project located on Governor's Island in New York City - in the shadow of Broadway - has invited the Q&Q FEARLESS Theater to be an artist-in-residence in their space this October!

Every year the Rising Sun Performance Company programs a Theatrical Artist Retreat & Residency in Nolan Park House 11 on the island. Over the course of the Residency, they host a different playwright and/or director each week to develop new play scripts and works in progress, as well as site-specific devised works.

For one week, the Q&Q will explore the ways to present its unique Live Animation performances to an audience that does not know or use Second Life.  After the week of discussions, development, and rehearsal, for two days we will perform LIVE at Governor's Island National Park and across the globe LIVE ONLINE.

This will be a ground-breaking NEW THEATRICAL FORM that's been years in the making.  Groups before the Q&Q have shown us some of the answers and the Q&Q has pounded out the rest.  Now is the time to SHOW OFF where we are, even as we have plans and dreams of doing MORE!

Publishing: 

UNTIL SOMEONE DOES IT!

This book is ALL ABOUT the Q&Q FEARLESS Theater.  It will trace our history, including the ups and the downs, talk about our productions, and include exactly how we do what we do including what software and settings it takes.

This will be a celebration and a retrospective..and most of all an INVITATION to other groups to JOIN US in presenting LIVE ANIMATION of the highest quality.

The book itself is full of timelines, pictures and behind-the-scenes stories of the road we've traveled so far.  But it is also a guide to building, producing and presenting top-quality shows.

Our plans far outstrip what we are able to achieve now, and we talk a LOT in the book about where we are going - what kinds of shows we want to do and what effects for stage and audience we are working to add to our shows.

It will be ALL ABOUT the Q&Q - from our beginnings to our dreams - in one full-color volume.

 

Our Campaign Goals

Money raised will be going to FOUR uses:  (more or less equally and in this order)

  1. Technical software/equipment for our Laboratorium Residency
  2. Travel and stay in New York
  3. Book editing, design, and promotion
  4. Royalties for shows

We want you to be a PART of it all

In simplest terms, we are giving you a chance to pre-order our book at a discount. 

  • An investment of $30 we will send you the eBook " Until Someone DOES IT" - including LIVE elements and links. [a $35 cover price after publication]
  • An investment of $50 we will send you the FULL-COLOR book "Until Someone DOES IT" with live material and links on CD. [a $60 cover price later]
  • For YOU, if you invest $150 we will list you in our PLAYBILL as a member of the troupe and invite you to "Bagels with the Cast" In New York during our residency there and autograph the PLAYBILL for you.
  • EVERY bit of support makes a difference to us!  For gifts ANY size we will send you a screensaver of the pictures from the book!

Under ANY Circumstances.....

Share our campaign [Indiegogo has good tools for that] to your friends and neighbors -- the Q&Q FEARLESS Theater is in an extraordinary position to BREAK OUT something entirely new and AMAZING in the world of theater - and you can help!

story:
The Bacchanals

Come closer...

We promise we won't bite.

Quietly now so they don't hear you. These actresses they scare easy.

Draw back the curtain and take a peek backstage into a world of paranoia, madness and drama.

The Bacchanals is a dark comedy which toys with Classical traditions and texts whilst exploring the gender politics of theatre. A piece of new writing, inspired by Euripides's Bacchae, which asks: what happens if you trap a chorus of actresses in a small room, throw in some Greek mythology for good measure and turn the pressure up?

This is a blood soaked, modern comedy for a Dionysian age.

‘irreverent, ferocious, and inciting’ ★★★★★ London Pub Theatres Guide

'See. It' Theatrestück Blog

Who are we?

We are Mikra Theatricals, a group of female producers, writers and actors, who are working to create new and exciting theatre which places female narratives centre stage. This is our debut Edinburgh Fringe production.

The Bacchanals is a new play written by three of our number: Bess Roche, Katerina Ntroudi and Lauren Orrock whose previous work, both together and separately, has been performed at a number of London theatres including Theatre503, The Cockpit and Southwark Playhouse. The Bacchanals is their first full length collaboration.

We are also excited to be joined by our director, Jack Sain (How I Learned to Drive- Southwark Playhouse, Four Play- Old Vic New Voices and Resident Assistant Director at the Donmar Warehouse), who has staged, crafted and re-shaped the show for the Edinburgh fringe into a startling, colourful and electrifying performance... with UV lights (probably).

The Bacchanals gives the women of Euripides’ Bacchae a voice. Help us take that voice to the Edinburgh Fringe. 

We promise we'll be loud!

The Journey

Cast your minds back to early May 2017 when ‘Shape of You’ had been top of the charts for 11 weeks and three young actresses asked the question: why in a play called the Bacchae do we not get to see the Bacchae?

This was the beginning of what would become The Bacchanals.

The goal was to create a show which married Greek classical tragedy with actresses behaving badly, whilst simultaneously discussing some of the issues facing women today. And that's exactly what we did!

The Bacchanals was invited to be a part of the Voila! International Festival, and in November  enjoyed a sell-out run at the Etcetera Theatre, Camden. But this was not the end of our journey. We have since set our sights on the Mount Olympus of theatre festivals: the Edinburgh Fringe!

We could not have made it this far without the help of the lovely people at Voila!, the Gilbert Murray Trust and our incredible original team.

So... what do you need me for?!

We are in the midst of preparing and re-rehearsing the show, with a re-vamped vibe and an exciting new soundtrack. 

Whilst we have some money from the previous run that we have re-invested we need to raise an additional £3k to make this show the best it can be and ensure a successful and sustainable run at the Fringe.

What is the Edinburgh Fringe Festival?

Edinburgh Fringe Festival is the largest performing arts festival in the world.
Throughout August, the beautiful city of Edinburgh will be inundated with over 3 million visitors and 30,000 performers.
We are hoping, with your help to be a tiny drop in that ocean.

It is wonderfully open-access and allows new and up and coming work the chance to showcase their talents, however it takes a lot of resources to make it that far North- and then to stand out amongst the avalanche of flyers.

How is your money being spent?
Basically on chocolate digestives. And wine. All the wine. Mainly wine.
But also…

Donations will support:

Edinburgh Fringe Festival Run
- Festival and Venue Fees
- Marketing
- Printing promotional materials (posters, flyers)
- Costume and set
General Production Costs
- Creative team
- Rehearsal room rental
- Marketing and publicity for the show

Help these Bacchic bitches get to the Edinburgh Fringe!

Other ways you can help...
If you aren't able to financially support us, do not worry we totally understand! But there are other ways you can help!
Share this page- to anyone and everyone who might be interested. The wider the reach, the better the chance of reaching our goal!
 

Thank You!
We couldn’t continue this journey without your support so thank you for reading this far and for throwing your lot in with ours on this mad, wild dream of a show!

story:
A Summary of Dancing England and the re-boot

As you probably know by now, Dancing England was a incredibly successful series of traditional dance showcase events run between 1979 and 1987 at the Derby Assembly Rooms. 30 years later, it happened again. Sheffield, 2017.

We think there's enough interest out there to run the show again, and make it a regular event.

My name is still Edwin Dyson and along with Phil Heaton, Arwen Heaton, Amy O'Brien, and Eilidh Smith, I'm one of the organisers for Dancing England 2019. I have strong family connections to the initial series, and Arwen was the organiser of the Daughter of Dancing England events.

I was there between 1979 and 1987, soaking up the atmosphere, enjoying the traditional dancing and being entranced by re-enactments of some of our most interesting and unique folklore customs. I MC'd the 2017 event, Arwen stage managed the whole affair, Phil sold posters, programmes, and more importantly put the bulk of the acts together, and Eilidh and Amy admirably ran backstage.

We've a good team in place for Dancing England 2019, and some great acts already lined up for you to enjoy; including some old(er) faces dancing Cotswold Morris, Rapper Sword, Step Clog, Molly, Longsword, Border Morris and North West. But joined together with younger teams, both aiming to showcase the tradition and the vibrancy of traditional dance in the UK. 

After the 2017 re-boot, we realised that there's a wealth of good feeling and nostalgia out there for Dancing England, and we know people really want it to happen again. We need some more help to get the 2019 event under way, deposits need paying, publicity material needs printing and shipping.

If you choose to take part in this crowdfunding exercise and contribute to Dancing England 2019, you would be joining us in ensuring that some of our fantastic traditional and revival dancing teams are seen by a wider audience and that our more unique folklore customs are kept alive and known.

Might you be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

I'll break this down for you in more detail:

To run an event like this takes money, there's no bones about it. We need to raise approximately £2750 to pay for venue deposits and the like.

Tickets will go on sale in due course through the venue, but we want to get Dancing England 2019 set up on a firm financial footing first. This will hopefully ensure some stability for the future. The organisers will also be contributing financially to the event. We've also applied for National Lottery money, and grants from other sources too.

There are two types of crowdfunding for this project. Firstly you could become a Patron of Dancing England. This costs £40 and in return you would receive our heartfelt thanks, a mention in publicity, early entry to the event enabling you to get one of the best seats in the house and a free programme and poster.

Secondly, if you felt unable to be a Patron, you could be a Supporter of Dancing England in return for £10 of your hard earned money. This would again earn you a significant amount of gratitude, a thank you in the programme and the knowledge that you've helped a much-loved and oft-missed traditional dance event take place once again.

The Impact Of Your Funding

Your funding contribution will make a real difference to Dancing England and the people that want to come and watch the teams take part.

England is full of peculiar and exciting customs and traditions. Dancing England enables people to experience and appreciate our vast wealth of cultural heritage.

Dancing England was a glimpse of spring in the depths of winter. It was a highlight on people's calendars. It was valued and loved. We think there's enough love for this to happen again.

Risks & Challenges

Of course there are risks in organising an event like this. With proper planning we can mitigate most or all of those.

We are starting small. By 1987 Dancing England had grown to an audience of 2000. Our new Nottingham venue has a capacity of 700.

We will be harnessing the power of social media to spread the message, build enthusiasm for the event and to crowdfund Dancing England.

If, in the sad event, we don't raise a sufficient amount of monies, we will work with the venue to see how they can help. If in the sadder event that doesn't work, then we will refund everyone's contributions and say thank you.

We don't want that to happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you might not be able to help financially at this point in time, but that doesn't mean that you can't assist in other ways.

Please help us to get the word out and make some noise about Dancing England.

Please Share, Like and Retweet this crowdfunding campaign on Facebook and other social media

You could also use the Indiegogo share tools!

Why not get in touch and ask for a flyer or poster to take along to your local folk club or dance practice?

Thank you for reading the pitch so far. Now, might we ask you for that contribution? Find 'Select A Perk' at the top right of this page and choose one! Thank you.

story:
Our Story:

Devon Frieder is a professional actor and choreographer in New York City. She graduated from the Boston Conservatory with a B.F.A. in Musical Theatre, during and after which she began producing shows in Santa Fe and Albuquerque to provide other young, aspiring performers with exciting new performing opportunities. Her theatre company has continued to grow every year and this winter she will be producing the hit movie-based musical Bring It On, with music and lyrics written by Hamilton's Lin-Manuel Miranda.

This will be the 13th show she has directed, produced, and choreographed for teens/young adults in New Mexico.  Past shows include First Date*, Heathers+, Dirty Rotten Scoundrels*, Lysistrata Jones*, The Wedding Singer+, Xanadu*, The Drowsy Chaperone, 13: The Musical*, Gypsy, You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown, The Fantasticks, and The Last Five Years.

*denotes a New Mexico Premiere  +denotes an Albuquerque Premiere

The Impact:

Bring It On has nearly 40 people involved in the production, including cast and crew members.  Many of these young people have appeared in multiple productions because of the impact the shows have made on their lives.  Devon has received multiple letters from former cast members thanking her for helping them rediscover their love for theatre and, in some cases, overcome their fears of performing in public.  

In addition to gaining an intensive theatre experience that many no longer receive in school due to lack of arts funding, they are also developing artistic passions that they may not have had before and building life-long friendships and connections.

 What We Need:

The majority of the funds needed for this project will go towards renting the rehearsal and performance space, officially licensing the show through Music Theatre International, and providing accompaniment tracks, props, costumes, and sets.  All of Devon's shows would not have been possible without the extremely generous help of patrons and supporters like you.  Please help make this production of Bring It On a reality with your contribution today. Even $5 can buy a necessary prop, and $20 can costume an entire character.

 Other Ways You Can Help:

Spread the word!  If you have ever been involved in or seen one of Devon's shows, you understand the kind of impact they have on both performers and audiences alike.  We urge you to tell everyone you know about this campaign and pitch in; remember, every little bit helps!
story_txt:
Our Story:
Devon Frieder is a professional actor and choreographer in New York City. She graduated from the Boston Conservatory with a B.F.A. in Musical Theatre, during and after which she began producing shows in Santa Fe and Albuquerque to provide other young, aspiring performers with exciting new performing opportunities. Her theatre company has continued to grow every year and this winter she will be producing the hit movie-based musical Bring It On, with music and lyrics written by Hamilton's Lin-Manuel Miranda.
This will be the 13th show she has directed, produced, and choreographed for teens/young adults in New Mexico.  Past shows include First Date*, Heathers+, Dirty Rotten Scoundrels*, Lysistrata Jones*, The Wedding Singer+, Xanadu*, The Drowsy Chaperone, 13: The Musical*, Gypsy, You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown, The Fantasticks, and The Last Five Years.
*denotes a New Mexico Premiere  +denotes an Albuquerque Premiere
The Impact:
Bring It On has nearly 40 people involved in the production, including cast and crew members.  Many of these young people have appeared in multiple productions because of the impact the shows have made on their lives.  Devon has received multiple letters from former cast members thanking her for helping them rediscover their love for theatre and, in some cases, overcome their fears of performing in public.  
In addition to gaining an intensive theatre experience that many no longer receive in school due to lack of arts funding, they are also developing artistic passions that they may not have had before and building life-long friendships and connections.
 What We Need:
The majority of the funds needed for this project will go towards renting the rehearsal and performance space, officially licensing the show through Music Theatre International, and providing accompaniment tracks, props, costumes, and sets.  All of Devon's shows would not have been possible without the extremely generous help of patrons and supporters like you.  Please help make this production of Bring It On a reality with your contribution today. Even $5 can buy a necessary prop, and $20 can costume an entire character.
 Other Ways You Can Help:

story:
Who we are and what we want

Thank you for considering funding ILLEGALISED!

We are BEZNĂ Theatre, a British-Romanian interventionist political theatre collective formed in London in 2013 by Sînziana Koenig and Nico Vaccari. Part of our team are Producer Claire Gilbert, Actress Oana Pușcatu and Sound Designer Daniel Balfour. We were brought together by the need to make a political theatre that investigates societal inequalities and confronts institutional and normalised violences. Central to our practice is the close collaboration with activists and experts as part of the fieldwork, research and creation process.

This project is vital. It is vital for the the 40 people we interviewed as their lived experience will be honoured and brought to the stage but it is also vital to the hundreds of thousands of people seeking asylum who are mistreated, ignored, who end up self-harming or committing suicide because of the horrendous conditions in which they are forced to live. It is vital for the reality of their lives to be seen and heard by all of you, those with the power to do something about it. This project is vital to the hundreds of thousands of 'failed asylum seekers', those the Home Office has condemned to living underground lives without any security. Those too terrified to return home and who cannot go to the hospital if they are ill or to the Police if they are mistreated. ILLEGALISED is for them.

Your donations will go towards helping us pay everyone involved to bring the true lived experiences of the people we interviewed to the stage. By showing ILLEGALISED to a wide variety of audiences across the UK we will be raising awareness, calling people to action and inspiring solidarity. We will also provide employment for two of the refugees we interviewed whose anonymous testimony will be a central part of the show.

 

Our scheduled tour dates are

  • Camden People’s Theatre, London, Tuesday 30 April - Thursday 2 May
  • Slung Low, Leeds, Sunday 5 May (pay what you can on the door) 
  • Royal Exchange, Manchester, Thursday 9 - Saturday 11 May
  • Applecart Arts, London, Thursday 16 - Saturday 18 May
  • The Place, Bedford, Monday 20 May (on sale soon)
  • Northern Stage, Newcastle, Thursday 23 & Friday 24 May

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise £17,980 in total. Yes, that is a lot of money.

We will use this money to pay for the fees of everybody involved in the show. There can be no art without artists and there can be no political, world-changing art without the people involved. We firmly believe that artists deserve fair payment for their work and we want to make sure we can deliver that.

Your donations will pay for

  • the Refugees' fee to be present in rehearsals 1 day/week (2x£400)
  • the Set and Costume Designer's fee (£1500)
  • the Lighting Designer's fee (£1200)
  • the Sound Designer's fee (£1200)
  • the two Director-Writers' fees (2x£2000)
  • the Producer's fee (£2000)
  • the Actors' fees (4x£455/rehearsal week=£7280)

This is where the exorbitant amount of £17,980 comes from. It is incredibly expensive to rehearse a show and deliver good quality.

We want to give you something in return for your support

  • If you support up to £50 we will publicly thank you and send you an e-mail with details of where the money will go.
  • If you support up to £100 we will do the above AND send you a signed poster. 
  • If you support up to £500 we will do the above AND give you 2 free tickets to any performance of your choice.
  • If you support up to £1000 we will do the above AND invite you into rehearsals. 
  • If you support over £1000 we will do the above and invite you to dinner with the founders of the company.

Even if we do not reach our entire goal, the funds will still go towards paying for people's fees. We will do anything we can to make ILLEGALISED happen.

Why it is important

We believe that art has the power to move people both figuratively and literally, good political art can move audiences to action and it can create solidarity.

We believe that we are the right theatre company to do this because:

  • We are a group of highly politicised and driven artists, we're done a huge amount of fieldwork and research, we have consulted with competent and passionate academics and activists and we are supported by a large group of partner organisations. 
  • We have the experience necessary! We've produced 6 full productions to date: Deathwatch (2013), CRIME (2015), CUNTHATE [ URÄ ], 112 (2017), boyz and girlz (2017) and VINOVAT,-Ä‚ (2018). Help us make 2019 the year of ILLEGALISED.
  • We make good quality work: we held 3 readings of ILLEGALISED in January 2019 (at The Place in Bedford and Camden People's Theatre &  Bookmarks Bookshop in London) and we received amazing feedback that we have implemented in the current draft. You can take a look at our reviews, look through our teasers and trailers or browse through our past productions to get a sense of our work.
  • People trust us: we were invited by a group of fierce and wonderful activists to perform an excerpt of ILLEGALISED at the People's Trial of the Home Office and Hostile Environment. You can watch some snippets here.
  • We really, really care. We are driven by the urgency of our cause. We want to make people's lives better. We want to get the world talking about how we treat the most vulnerable in our society, and we will do anything to get the message out.

Risks & Challenges

There are risks with every single project. We took a risk when we applied to the Arts Council knowing we wouldn't have time to reapply if unsuccessful. We did this because this project cannot wait. We knew our application was strong and our feedback was overwhelmingly positive, ACE scored the application as strong in every category, aside from Finance (where their conditions were met) and were only unsuccessful due to other projects having a greater amount of already secured funding.  Ironically we have spent the last 12 weeks fundraising and have covered the costs they are concerned about.  It was purely because they didn’t have enough money to be able to fund everyone at that meeting.

However we would have to wait another 12 weeks to start any work on the production. And rehearsals start in 30 days!
We will not be silenced. This play will be seen and heard, the plight of the people who shared their stories with us will reach wide audiences. And that’s where you come in.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you simply cannot help financially. But that doesn't mean you can't help at all! 

Please please get the word out and make some noise about us. We're fighting the good fight and we will do great things if you believe in us. Share this with someone who is in a position to help, use your social media reach, forward this to organisations you think might want to join our cause!

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Story

 

Hello, I’m TinaO. My story has already been changed because you are here. Thank you for your messiness and the innate brilliance you are. 

Thank you for your jagged and broken bits and the genius of you that is often misunderstood.

Thank you for your shame and shouting. Thank you for both.

I love the fierce positions you take but don’t always share.

Thank you for your aching confusion and the mystery of this time.

You are a story, and I am devoted to the mystery of us.

Starting in April 2021 I will be touring my Solo-Show: O MY GOD in small venues across Canada. I will also be releasing my book: Story Stones which connects the dots between twelve Core Stories, revolution histories, creation myths, and how we are all literally stardust.

 

 

We are a super-nova in the making.

We are descendants from the core. We live and express ourselves as a core-narrative from which we come.

 

My wish and ask is that you will:

 

  • Pre-order my book
  • Purchase tickets to my show and
  • Support my story & talk-back tour here

 

 

It's a STORY Triple Crown. 

 

Without a shift in where we place our listening, we will become the very thing we are afraid of: fake news, false leaders, and fractured societies. We are already well on our way along the path. 

Help me share the landscape of myth and story, support the healing of a trauma based narrative, and welcome a more compassionate, integrated and unflinching path to the tomorrow we are living into right now. 

 

 

 

Out on the Skinny Branches

 

If you've been around me for awhile you've probably heard me say 'Come out with me on the Skinny Branches.' It's only in the place where we are willing to risk shaking, even falling, that new footing can happen.

Both of these projects has me shaking.

 

___________________________________

THE BOOK - Story Stones...

 

  1. Explains hows we are literally stardust. This flesh, blood and bone is made of the same materials as the galaxy of stars above us.  
  2. Challenges the Christian path of one God - after experiencing a call to a life of service in faith.
  3. Invites us to believe there is such a thing as Core Story, a narrative on the very energy we are made of and from. 
  4. And brings you along my own Core Story as I consistently live through story ripple after story ripple of proof that I do or do not matter. 

These skinny branches are shaking and this is just the book!

 

LISTEN to excerpts from the book here:

14 Minutes: A Supernova Death

 
10 Minutes: Hands Down

 

 

PRE-ORDER THE BOOK

When you pre-order your copy of Story Stones, you are supporting the fastest delivery of my book in physical form. I am self-publishing with FriesenPress, a local and Canadian-proud publishing house who happens to be run by a sensational woman and champion of young leaders, Tammara Kennelly. We met a few years ago when we sat next to each other at a women's leadership luncheon in Victoria. My book will be in great hands. I trust her implicitly. The cost to bring my book to physical form (and get it to you), is approximately $6500. 

The pre-sale of a personally signed copy of Story Stones will be $60. 

When 200 of you pre-buy the book - the publishing cost is covered.

I always say to my clients, if you can't pre-sell 200 copies of your book, you aren't ready to launch one yet.

So this is me walking my talk. ;) 

___________________________________

 

MY SHOW - O MY GOD...

It seriously has me out on the skinny branches

 

I never set out to write a show about witches, patriarchy, and the lasting effect on society when six generations of children watch their mother's be accused and tortured to the point of hysteria so that they do indeed look and sound like the very witches they were accused of being.

Yet here I am.

I sat down to a blank page to write a clown show confessional about a 15,000 year old footprint and the many faces of God - and somehow in making that commitment, an Irish War Goddess named Morrigan came to visit... and now we're here. 

This show is important to me on many levels, but mostly because I LOVE and deeply value LIVE THEATRE and its ability to lovingly and compassionately say the unthinkable. 

These are unthinkable times. 

We could all use a safe place to say, see, and feel the unthinkable. 

I believe we're entering the Age of the Artist, and this show is my physical, mental, emotional and spiritual contribution to dismantling the dominance model we've been in  for fall too long. 

LISTEN to Excerpts from the Show O MY GOD

Waiting for the Dance

 

 

Annnnnd it's my 50th BIRTHDAY

So every show is a chance to

celebrate my birthday with me.

 

 

Tour Dates & Delights

 

In these covid times each performance will be socially distanced meaning there is likely to be a limited number of seats available/show. 

I will NOT be offering a digital version of this show until after the 2021 tour ends, however, if you would prefer to see the show and support the show by purchasing a digital copy which will be released in January 2022, a ticket option at $30 will be available for that too. 

___________________________________

Dates

  • April 15th 2021 - PRE-SHOW LAUNCH opening the 2021 FireCircle for PowHERhouse Impact Media
  • April 30/May 1st - 2 socially distanced shows in Gibsons at the Gibson Playhouse
  • May 14/15 - 2 socially distanced shows in Vancouver at The Cultch 
  • May 28/29 2021 - 2 socially distanced shows in Nanaimo at Harbour Theatre
  • *September 2021 - Courtney, Vancouver Island & Regina, Saskatchewan
  • *October 2021 - Halifax, Nova Scotia
  • *November 2021 - Seattle WA, and Santa Barbara, CA
  • *December 2021 - close out the year at The Cultch for a final Birthday Party Performanc

*Tickets for Fall 2021 go on sale June 2021

___________________________________

Cost Overview 

Each show will cost approx. $3500 to put on so I'm offering two ticket prices:

  • $40 for just the show (pay it forward, or pay for a seat).
  • $30 to attend the digital performance with a live talk-back in January 2022

 

 

The Age of the Artist 

 

The cool part of this Indiegogo Campaign is that every contribution has a return for you and me.

  • You get a show and a book.
  • I get to publish and to perform.

And the most important part is that we get to be together. 

The Age of the Artist calls on storytellers to weave their magic of myth and mystery to walk us through to the birth of a new way of relating with each other, the earth, and creation itself. 

Thank you for listening and thank you for believing in me. 

xxxT

 

___________________________________

READ EXCERPTS FROM 

The Book...

 

We are 65% Oxygen, 18% Carbon, 10% Hydrogen, 3% Nitrogen, 1.5% Calcium, 1.5% Phosphorus, and trace elements such as potassium, sulfur, sodium, magnesium, boron, Selenium, Copper and Zinc. Elements come from stars. We are literally made up of stardust. 

When stars die, the elements that were generated inside of them are swept out into space, and the next generation of stars from those elements burn and are swept out again. Everything we are originates from stardust. This cycle has been going on for thirteen billion years. Our solar system is considered to be less than one third of that time. We are only 4.5 billion years old. 

When you pick up a rock, something that has not and will not ever decompose, you are holding a remnant of The Big Bang in your hands. 

A visual I offer my story clients is this: 

We come into the world as a story stone, with a divine narrative of who we are tucked inside. We are made AS something FOR something. I happen to be someone who loves water, so I  imagine that as the stone of our being meets the ocean of our life, our story ripples out. Each ripple is a point of expansion of the story we are made as.

Think about a star’s gravity pulling it in as its nuclear force expands it out. This is our story ripple.

Not only are we a Story Stone, but we are also a star, and overtime, a supernova in the making.

We begin as stardust, words and impulses, like an enormous cloud of gas and dust many light-years across. The double-edge sword of our story, which is our medicine (gravity) and our poison (force), continues to collect to our core with every contraction and ripple until our outward pressure balances our inward pull. As the core of our story collects, contracts and releases, it begins to reach the outer layers and that’s when this story stone begins to shine. 

We are made AS something FOR something. We are made to shine as the star we are.

 

___________________________________

READ EXCERPTS FROM 

The Show...

 

 

I am one of three sisters.

And I am waiting. 

My sisters, they are much like the Petronillas

I’m sure you don’t know of them. 

Most don’t. 

 

These women are two of the same name, and with the same fate

One - Saint Petronilla of 2000 AD

So strikingly beautiful she was placed in a tower for safe-keeping

Only to die of a hunger strike

Because she refused to be married to a Pagan king. 

She is my sister.

She is a martyr, a ‘murdered for the faith’ kind

Like Saint Petronilla. 

 

My sister, Macha, is like her. 

Faithful.

Noble.

Naive.

And Dead.

 

My other sister, also a Petronilla

Petronilla de Meath of 1300 AD

Plain.

A servant for battle

And a witch,

Except she wasn’t a witch


She just knew how to take the fall for another woman, for protection,

And did.

And then at 24 was tortured without mercy

Flogged along a path between six parishes

That’s six churches for you in today’s words

and she was the first woman to be burned at the stake

In Kilkenny

named as a witch

 

My other sister: Nemain is like her

Simple.

Frenzied.

And Falsely named. 

Also dead. 

 

I am Morrigan.

I am the third sister. 

I am neither false witch, nor chosen saint.

I am not the martyr of your story.

I am not the woman who will fall for your wrong doing. 

And you cannot name me.

 

Takes both ravens into her hand and tosses them up to the sky

BLACK OUT.

 

___________________________________

ABOUT TINAO

 

Tina Overbury is a core-communications specialist who works with individuals and organizations who feel called.

She is a storyteller, performer, and a professional listener who works with narrative and story structure as a vehicle for human connection. Her work is rooted in Myth, Mysticism, and the practice of personal faith. She brings thirty years of collaborative storytelling in theatre, film, marketing, team based selling, and workshop facilitation. She is the founder of Live Your Best Story, a weekend retreat of deep listening held on Bowen Island, BC, Canada and is the voice and story behind TinaOLife, home to Story Stones, TinaO’s online gathering of listening in to sacred stories.

Tina is a proud associate of PowHERhouse media where she listens and supports the ‘stories’ of whole and integrated leaders of tomorrow.

 

___________________________________

LOVE FOR TINAO

 

Charlene Sanjenko - Founder, CEO PowHERhouse Impact Media Group

Something indescribable happens when you feel safe, supported, and protected. You allow yourself to remember. To honour The Story, your story.

Sometimes it’s painful when healing is present. The fullest expression of the Gift that is our life happensWith the time, space, and teachers needed to remember our whole story. I have known Tina O since 2015 and have worked closely with her for the past two years. Her patience, kindness, devotion to The Story and innate gifts as a listener and story keeper are like nothing I have ever experienced before. In deep gratitude, Charlene.

 

Christina Benty – Strategic Business Strategies​

Unfailingly kind and fiercely devoted, TinaO is a tenacious listener committed to sensing, seeing and serving the story within.

Her rich laughter and her joyful sense of wonder are eclipsed only by her perceptive insights.

By operating in her gifting, she draws out the gifting of others.  She invites and welcomes the shyest of stories to make themselves seen. But do not be fooled. She is a risk taker and a risk maker; she does not allow her clients to ignore or gloss over the nudges or the glaring jolts of what is emerging for them.

Wisdom is attended to. Truth is served. Mystery is honoured.

Unfailing kind, and fiercely devoted, Tina is a tenacious listener committed to sensing, seeing and serving the story within.

Her rich laughter and her joyful sense of wonder are eclipsed only by her perceptive insights.

By operating in her gifting, she draws out the gifting of others.  She invites and welcomes the shyest of stories to make themselves seen. But do not be fooled. She is a risk taker and a risk maker; she does not allow her clients to ignore or gloss over the nudges or the glaring jolts of what is emerging for them.

Wisdom is attended to. Truth is served. Mystery is honoured.

She is a Master of her craft. The crafter of stories. There is no one like TinaO.

 

Wendy Turner Larson – Psychologist, Coach, Facilitator + Speaker 

Tina Overbury and Meribeth Deen helped me write my first book, a book that has been inside of me for a number of years but which I struggled getting onto the written page.

They helped me transform the words and content into something amazing, that is me, but I could not do on my own. They did not help me get it done in record time, because the process is one of digging deep, uncovering more of what was within me and they guided me at every step to pull out ‘more’ from ‘me’.

They don’t take over. They guide. They coach. They ask. They listen. They challenge. They understand.

As a team, there is this intersection of gifts, talents, experience and personality that dovetail beautifully. I am a more confident writer because of these two. They are loyal and supportive. They are with you every step of the way.  Without them, I would have had a book. That’s it. With them, I have my life work, my words, my creation in a beautiful format that is now ready for the world to see. Know this! This is the team you want to have walk beside you through the process of writing and completing a book because they honor ‘you’ and your work.  I highly recommend Meribeth and Tina.  I will hire them again for Book Two.

 

___________________________________

IN THE MEDIA

 

Conversations in Courage with James Gardiner 

 
 
 

A Shade More with Dori Howard

 

 

Conversations for Change with Dolphin Kasper

 

___________________________________

Thank you for your shame and shouting. Thank you for both.
I love the fierce positions you take but don’t always share.
Thank you for your aching confusion and the mystery of this time.
You are a story, and I am devoted to the mystery of us.
Starting in April 2021 I will be touring my Solo-Show: O MY GOD in small venues across Canada. I will also be releasing my book: Story Stones which connects the dots between twelve Core Stories, revolution histories, creation myths, and how we are all literally stardust.
 

 
We are a super-nova in the making.
We are descendants from the core. We live and express ourselves as a core-narrative from which we come.
 
My wish and ask is that you will:
 

Pre-order my book
Purchase tickets to my show and
Support my story & talk-back tour here

 
 
It's a STORY Triple Crown. 
 
Without a shift in where we place our listening, we will become the very thing we are afraid of: fake news, false leaders, and fractured societies. We are already well on our way along the path. 
Help me share the landscape of myth and story, support the healing of a trauma based narrative, and welcome a more compassionate, integrated and unflinching path to the tomorrow we are living into right now. 
 


 
 
Out on the Skinny Branches
 
If you've been around me for awhile you've probably heard me say 'Come out with me on the Skinny Branches.' It's only in the place where we are willing to risk shaking, even falling, that new footing can happen.
Both of these projects has me shaking.
 
___________________________________
THE BOOK - Story Stones...
 


Explains hows we are literally stardust. This flesh, blood and bone is made of the same materials as the galaxy of stars above us.  

Challenges the Christian path of one God - after experiencing a call to a life of service in faith.

Invites us to believe there is such a thing as Core Story, a narrative on the very energy we are made of and from. 
And brings you along my own Core Story as I consistently live through story ripple after story ripple of proof that I do or do not matter. 

These skinny branches are shaking and this is just the book!
 
LISTEN to excerpts from the book here:
14 Minutes: A Supernova Death

 
10 Minutes: Hands Down


 

 
PRE-ORDER THE BOOK
When you pre-order your copy of Story Stones, you are supporting the fastest delivery of my book in physical form. I am self-publishing with FriesenPress, a local and Canadian-proud publishing house who happens to be run by a sensational woman and champion of young leaders, Tammara Kennelly. We met a few years ago when we sat next to each other at a women's leadership luncheon in Victoria. My book will be in great hands. I trust her implicitly. The cost to bring my book to physical form (and get it to you), is approximately $6500. 
The pre-sale of a personally signed copy of Story Stones will be $60. 
When 200 of you pre-buy the book - the publishing cost is covered.
I always say to my clients, if you can't pre-sell 200 copies of your book, you aren't ready to launch one yet.
So this is me walking my talk. ;) 

___________________________________

 
MY SHOW - O MY GOD...
It seriously has me out on the skinny branches
 
I never set out to write a show about witches, patriarchy, and the lasting effect on society when six generations of children watch their mother's be accused and tortured to the point of hysteria so that they do indeed look and sound like the very witches they were accused of being.
Yet here I am.
I sat down to a blank page to write a clown show confessional about a 15,000 year old footprint and the many faces of God - and somehow in making that commitment, an Irish War Goddess named Morrigan came to visit... and now we're here. 
This show is important to me on many levels, but mostly because I LOVE and deeply value LIVE THEATRE and its ability to lovingly and compassionately say the unthinkable. 
These are unthinkable times. 
We could all use a safe place to say, see, and feel the unthinkable. 
I believe we're entering the Age of the Artist, and this show is my physical, mental, emotional and spiritual contribution to dismantling the dominance model we've been in  for fall too long. 
LISTEN to Excerpts from the Show O MY GOD
Waiting for the Dance

 
 
Annnnnd it's my 50th BIRTHDAY
So every show is a chance to 
celebrate my birthday with me.
 

 
Tour Dates & Delights
 
In these covid times each performance will be socially distanced meaning there is likely to be a limited number of seats available/show. 
I will NOT be offering a digital version of this show until after the 2021 tour ends, however, if you would prefer to see the show and support the show by purchasing a digital copy which will be released in January 2022, a ticket option at $30 will be available for that too. 
___________________________________
Dates

April 15th 2021 - PRE-SHOW LAUNCH opening the 2021 FireCircle for PowHERhouse Impact Media
April 30/May 1st - 2 socially distanced shows in Gibsons at the Gibson Playhouse
May 14/15 - 2 socially distanced shows in Vancouver at The Cultch 
May 28/29 2021 - 2 socially distanced shows in Nanaimo at Harbour Theatre
*September 2021 - Courtney, Vancouver Island & Regina, Saskatchewan
*October 2021 - Halifax, Nova Scotia
*November 2021 - Seattle WA, and Santa Barbara, CA
*December 2021 - close out the year at The Cultch for a final Birthday Party Performanc

*Tickets for Fall 2021 go on sale June 2021
___________________________________
Cost Overview 
Each show will cost approx. $3500 to put on so I'm offering two ticket prices:

$40 for just the show (pay it forward, or pay for a seat).
$30 to attend the digital performance with a live talk-back in January 2022

 


 
The Age of the Artist 
 
The cool part of this Indiegogo Campaign is that every contribution has a return for you and me.

You get a show and a book.
I get to publish and to perform.

And the most important part is that we get to be together. 
The Age of the Artist calls on storytellers to weave their magic of myth and mystery to walk us through to the birth of a new way of relating with each other, the earth, and creation itself. 
Thank you for listening and thank you for believing in me. 
xxxT
 
___________________________________
READ EXCERPTS FROM 
The Book...
 

We are 65% Oxygen, 18% Carbon, 10% Hydrogen, 3% Nitrogen, 1.5% Calcium, 1.5% Phosphorus, and trace elements such as potassium, sulfur, sodium, magnesium, boron, Selenium, Copper and Zinc. Elements come from stars. We are literally made up of stardust. 
When stars die, the elements that were generated inside of them are swept out into space, and the next generation of stars from those elements burn and are swept out again. Everything we are originates from stardust. This cycle has been going on for thirteen billion years. Our solar system is considered to be less than one third of that time. We are only 4.5 billion years old. 
When you pick up a rock, something that has not and will not ever decompose, you are holding a remnant of The Big Bang in your hands. 
A visual I offer my story clients is this: 
We come into the world as a story stone, with a divine narrative of who we are tucked inside. We are made AS something FOR something. I happen to be someone who loves water, so I  imagine that as the stone of our being meets the ocean of our life, our story ripples out. Each ripple is a point of expansion of the story we are made as.
Think about a star’s gravity pulling it in as its nuclear force expands it out. This is our story ripple.
Not only are we a Story Stone, but we are also a star, and overtime, a supernova in the making.
We begin as stardust, words and impulses, like an enormous cloud of gas and dust many light-years across. The double-edge sword of our story, which is our medicine (gravity) and our poison (force), continues to collect to our core with every contraction and ripple until our outward pressure balances our inward pull. As the core of our story collects, contracts and releases, it begins to reach the outer layers and that’s when this story stone begins to shine. 
We are made AS something FOR something. We are made to shine as the star we are.
 
___________________________________
READ EXCERPTS FROM 
The Show...
 

 
I am one of three sisters.
And I am waiting. 
My sisters, they are much like the Petronillas
I’m sure you don’t know of them. 
Most don’t.  These women are two of the same name, and with the same fate
One - Saint Petronilla of 2000 AD
So strikingly beautiful she was placed in a tower for safe-keeping
Only to die of a hunger strike
Because she refused to be married to a Pagan king. 
She is my sister.
She is a martyr, a ‘murdered for the faith’ kind
Like Saint Petronilla.  My sister, Macha, is like her. 
Faithful.
Noble.
Naive.
And Dead. My other sister, also a Petronilla
Petronilla de Meath of 1300 AD
Plain.
A servant for battle
And a witch,
Except she wasn’t a witch
She just knew how to take the fall for another woman, for protection,
And did.
And then at 24 was tortured without mercy
Flogged along a path between six parishes
That’s six churches for you in today’s words
and she was the first woman to be burned at the stake
In Kilkenny
named as a witch My other sister: Nemain is like her
Simple.
Frenzied.
And Falsely named. 
Also dead.  I am Morrigan.
I am the third sister. 
I am neither false witch, nor chosen saint.
I am not the martyr of your story.
I am not the woman who will fall for your wrong doing. 
And you cannot name me. Takes both ravens into her hand and tosses them up to the sky
BLACK OUT.
 
___________________________________
ABOUT TINAO
 

Tina Overbury is a core-communications specialist who works with individuals and organizations who feel called.
She is a storyteller, performer, and a professional listener who works with narrative and story structure as a vehicle for human connection. Her work is rooted in Myth, Mysticism, and the practice of personal faith. She brings thirty years of collaborative storytelling in theatre, film, marketing, team based selling, and workshop facilitation. She is the founder of Live Your Best Story, a weekend retreat of deep listening held on Bowen Island, BC, Canada and is the voice and story behind TinaOLife, home to Story Stones, TinaO’s online gathering of listening in to sacred stories.
Tina is a proud associate of PowHERhouse media where she listens and supports the ‘stories’ of whole and integrated leaders of tomorrow.
 
___________________________________
LOVE FOR TINAO
 

Charlene Sanjenko - Founder, CEO PowHERhouse Impact Media Group
Something indescribable happens when you feel safe, supported, and protected. You allow yourself to remember. To honour The Story, your story.
Sometimes it’s painful when healing is present. The fullest expression of the Gift that is our life happensWith the time, space, and teachers needed to remember our whole story. I have known Tina O since 2015 and have worked closely with her for the past two years. Her patience, kindness, devotion to The Story and innate gifts as a listener and story keeper are like nothing I have ever experienced before. In deep gratitude, Charlene.
 

Christina Benty – Strategic Business Strategies​
Unfailingly kind and fiercely devoted, TinaO is a tenacious listener committed to sensing, seeing and serving the story within.
Her rich laughter and her joyful sense of wonder are eclipsed only by her perceptive insights.
By operating in her gifting, she draws out the gifting of others.  She invites and welcomes the shyest of stories to make themselves seen. But do not be fooled. She is a risk taker and a risk maker; she does not allow her clients to ignore or gloss over the nudges or the glaring jolts of what is emerging for them.
Wisdom is attended to. Truth is served. Mystery is honoured.
Unfailing kind, and fiercely devoted, Tina is a tenacious listener committed to sensing, seeing and serving the story within.
Her rich laughter and her joyful sense of wonder are eclipsed only by her perceptive insights.
By operating in her gifting, she draws out the gifting of others.  She invites and welcomes the shyest of stories to make themselves seen. But do not be fooled. She is a risk taker and a risk maker; she does not allow her clients to ignore or gloss over the nudges or the glaring jolts of what is emerging for them.
Wisdom is attended to. Truth is served. Mystery is honoured.
She is a Master of her craft. The crafter of stories. There is no one like TinaO.
 

Wendy Turner Larson – Psychologist, Coach, Facilitator + Speaker 
Tina Overbury and Meribeth Deen helped me write my first book, a book that has been inside of me for a number of years but which I struggled getting onto the written page. 
They helped me transform the words and content into something amazing, that is me, but I could not do on my own. They did not help me get it done in record time, because the process is one of digging deep, uncovering more of what was within me and they guided me at every step to pull out ‘more’ from ‘me’. 
They don’t take over. They guide. They coach. They ask. They listen. They challenge. They understand. 
As a team, there is this intersection of gifts, talents, experience and personality that dovetail beautifully. I am a more confident writer because of these two. They are loyal and supportive. They are with you every step of the way.  Without them, I would have had a book. That’s it. With them, I have my life work, my words, my creation in a beautiful format that is now ready for the world to see. Know this! This is the team you want to have walk beside you through the process of writing and completing a book because they honor ‘you’ and your work.  I highly recommend Meribeth and Tina.  I will hire them again for Book Two.
 
___________________________________
IN THE MEDIA
 
Conversations in Courage with James Gardiner 

 
 
 
A Shade More with Dori Howard


 
 
Conversations for Change with Dolphin Kasper

 
___________________________________

story:
The Show - Medusa

For Dante she was the erotic power that could destroy men. Freud saw in her hair a nest of terrifying snakes symbolizing castration. For Perseus and his patriarchal culture she was a dangerous female monster to be destroyed. 

Medusa’s reputation has transformed over time, and continues to intrigue and inspire us. Women see her as a noble victim of the patriarchy. The fashion house Versace celebrates the lure of her mysterious face and puts it on underwear, luxury bags, and expensive dinnerware. Politically charged media superimposes her image onto powerful, successful women. In our culture now she is once again a power player demanding to be recognized. Demanding we examine the journey from maiden to monster. 

Don't close your eyes...you don't want to miss it!

Who We Are

Global Hive Laboratories is an international collective  of companies and artists including Fusion Theatre Company in London, Chez Actors in Italy, La Compagnie Certes in France and BoucheWHACKED! Collective in Canada. Together we are committed to breaking down barriers that might exclude portions of the population from artistic dialogue.

The Global Hive spans across continents, bringing together practitioners of varied identities and social locations. With every new collaboration, we seek to expand our understanding of justice, equity, compassion, and storytelling. Our collective is made up of artists who are men, women, trans, and gender-nonconforming, who identify as one or multiple intersections of the following social and cultural groups: Latinx, Black British, African American, Afro-Latinx, Native American, Asian American, Canadian British, Two-Spirit, physically disabled, Blind, Low Vision, Deaf, Hard of Hearing,  bi-racial, immigrants, parents, and grandparents. Collectively, we speak English, Spanish, French, Cantonese, Korean, Czech, and Italian.

What have we done so far?

Across 2018 and 2019 we have worked with artists across the world, led research and development workshops and performances in three countries. We have developed a model of anti-exclusionary, multi-sensory theatrical experiences for our audiences. We produced workshops in England, France, Italy and most recently in Chicago, where we performed in multiple neighborhoods.  We partnered with cultural and artistic organizations such as Read/Write Library, Pilsen Outpost, En Las Tablas Performing Arts, Segundo Ruiz Belvis Cultural Center, and the legendary Steppenwolf Theatre’s Lookout Series!

Our Goal

We are passionate about breaking down as many barriers as possible when it comes to accessing professional art. Over the period, we have refined our model of inclusive theatre, Integrating design and sevices for audience members with disabilities into the creation and rehearsal process. This means that we offer Relaxed Performances with Audio Description, Touch Tours and Captioning services at every show; more ‘traditional’ theatre experiences generally provide these services once or twice in a theatre run and are not often aesthetically or dramatically integrated into the production.

We endeavour to create anti-exclusionary devised theatre through skill sharing, crowdsourced technology, and administrative crossover on a global scale. We create accessible artistic conversations about the issues in our communities and increase awareness of underlying connections and associations between groups who may otherwise not have engaged with one another.

Shows

We have managed to book shows in two fantastic theatres in London, to produce a full-scale version of our show! 

Here are the performance dates:

11th - 15th November 

Pleasance Theatre, Carpenters Mews, North Rd, London, N7 9EF.

8pm - Downstairs

AND

2nd - 6th March

Cockpit Theatre, Gateforth Street, Marylebone NW8 8EH.

7:30pm 

If you would like to buy tickets, please follow the link below!

https://www.pleasance.co.uk/event/medusa#overview

Risks and Challenges

Theatre is expensive!

Thus far we have funded the project from our own pockets, but to fully realise our production...we need your help to make it a reality.

We want to work with excellent performers and to compensate them well for the hard work they do.  

Here is a list of our costs...

Artists x 7

Creative Team x 4

Producer

Technician

Marketing

Venue Deposits

Printing

Rehearsal Space

Transport - set and people

PLEASE HELP!

If  you believe in what we are doing and you are able, please donate whatever you can!

If you aren’t able to give right now, please share our page with your networks.

The money you donate today will go towards realising this project.

Even if it’s only £1, every little bit really does help! 

You can find out more information about the work we are doing, about Global Hive Labs, Fusion Theatre Company and all our partner organisations on our social media accounts at the following places:

http://www.fusiontheatre.london

http://www.globalhivelabs.org

Follow us on social media @thelondonfusion and @globalhivelabs!

THANK YOU!

x

story:
Hey There!

It's me! Kelly! You probably already know who I am, but if you don't, welcome to my campaign! I've decided to sign up for a Nine Month Acting Conservatory program at The Studio/New York, which means from January to September, I'll be immersing myself in scene study, voice, movement, clown & lucid body classes all to further my knowledge and expertise in acting.

 

Why Do I Need This?

You've seen me in shows, in concerts, in YouTube videos (thanks, Nicole) and I've been studying acting for several years now, but the classes I've been taking have been only scene study, six hours a week.

This conservatory would be 5 days a week, 7 hours a day, for 9 months and would include the voice, movement, clown & lucid body components in addition to scene study with the best instructors out there. Training is a huge part of being a professional actor and the program will give me the tools I need to take my acting career to the next level.

 

What I Need

 It's an unfortunate truth that I don't have $17,000 sitting in the bank (if you do have a spare $17,000 call me ;)) That being said, all contributions will go directly to my tuition.

Conservatory Tuition - $17,000 

 

The Impact

I'll be working to cover all my living expenses during conservatory. Your donations will help me avoid paying a personal loan payment during those nine months as well.

 

Risks & Challenges

Some of you may have donated under the following categories:

"Shout Out During My Emmy Acceptance Speech"  

"Shout Out During My Golden Globe Acceptance Speech"  

"Shout Out During My Academy Award Acceptance Speech"  

This unfortunately is not a guarantee. You may, therefore, never receive your gift. My sincerest apologies in advance (I'll still send you all the gifts from the previous levels). Otherwise, this is a zero risk donation!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please SHARE with everybody you know. Yes. Everybody. Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, in-person, over the phone, hell, even by snail mail. If you can't donate, maybe somebody else you know can!

I LOVE YOU ALL

-Kelly
